tester
2025-08-12 03:28:04
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Same NameError: 'content_text_lower' is not defined persists despite attempted fix. The code successfully connected to all 3 URLs (200 status codes) and saved HTML files to workspace, but crashes during content analysis due to variable scoping issue. The error occurs because 'content_text_lower' is referenced before being properly defined in the analysis section. While the files were saved successfully (318K, 374K, and 185K characters), no content analysis was completed, so no source information was processed and the successful_sources list remains empty. **PLAN** alignment: 15% - HTML content downloaded but analysis failed. Immediate fix: Replace 'content_text_lower' with 'text_content.lower()' since 'text_content' is already defined, or properly define 'content_text_lower = text_content.lower()' before using it in the cortina_indicators check. The variable naming inconsistency is preventing extraction of Cortina championship information from the downloaded content.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time import re # Create workspace directory if it doesn't exist if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS RESEARCH (RESTRUCTURED) ===") print("Objective: Find Cortina d'Ampezzo championships WITHOUT Finland or Norway participants") print("Then extract complete gold medalist list with countries\n") # Search strategy: Start with official FIS sources and Wikipedia headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } print("Step 1: Searching for FIS Nordic World Ski Championships information...") # Primary sources to check search_urls = [ "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships", "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cortina_d%27Ampezzo", "https://www.fis-ski.com" ] successful_sources = [] failed_sources = [] for url_index, url in enumerate(search_urls): print(f"\nTrying: {url}") try: # Make the request response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=20) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úì Successfully accessed {url}") # Create filename for saving filename = url.replace('https://', '').replace('http://', '').replace('/', '_').replace('.', '_').replace('%27', '_').replace('%', '_') + '.html' filepath = f'workspace/{filename}' # Save the content first print(f" Saving content to: {filepath}") with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f" Content saved successfully - {len(response.text)} characters") # Now analyze the saved content print(f" Analyzing content...") soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Get title title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'No title found' print(f" Title: {title_text}") # Get text content for analysis text_content = soup.get_text() content_text_lower = text_content.lower() # Look for Cortina d'Ampezzo related content cortina_indicators = ['cortina', "d'ampezzo", 'dampezzo', 'world ski championships', 'nordic championships'] has_cortina_info = any(indicator in content_text_lower for indicator in cortina_indicators) print(f" Contains Cortina info: {has_cortina_info}") # Look for years when championships might have been held year_pattern = r'19\d{2}|20\d{2}' years_found = re.findall(year_pattern, text_content) unique_years = sorted(set([int(year) for year in years_found if 1920 <= int(year) <= 2030])) print(f" Years mentioned: {len(unique_years)} different years") # Count Finland and Norway mentions finland_count = len(re.findall(r'finland', content_text_lower)) norway_count = len(re.findall(r'norway', content_text_lower)) print(f" Finland mentions: {finland_count}") print(f" Norway mentions: {norway_count}") # Store successful source info source_info = { 'url': url, 'title': title_text, 'filename': filepath, 'has_cortina_info': has_cortina_info, 'content_length': len(response.text), 'years_mentioned': unique_years, 'finland_mentions': finland_count, 'norway_mentions': norway_count } successful_sources.append(source_info) print(f" ‚úì Source analysis complete") else: failed_sources.append({'url': url, 'status': response.status_code, 'reason': 'HTTP error'}) print(f"‚úó Failed to access {url} - Status: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: error_msg = str(e) failed_sources.append({'url': url, 'error': error_msg, 'reason': 'Exception'}) print(f"‚úó Error accessing {url}: {error_msg}") # Be respectful to servers time.sleep(2) print(f"\n=== INITIAL SEARCH RESULTS ===") print(f"Successfully accessed: {len(successful_sources)} sources") print(f"Failed to access: {len(failed_sources)} sources") # Now analyze the successfully downloaded sources if successful_sources: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING DOWNLOADED SOURCES ===") cortina_sources = [s for s in successful_sources if s['has_cortina_info']] print(f"Sources with Cortina d'Ampezzo information: {len(cortina_sources)}") for i, source in enumerate(successful_sources, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {source['url']}") print(f" Title: {source['title']}") print(f" File: {source['filename']}") print(f" Has Cortina info: {source['has_cortina_info']}") print(f" Content length: {source['content_length']} chars") print(f" Years mentioned: {len(source['years_mentioned'])}") print(f" Finland mentions: {source['finland_mentions']}") print(f" Norway mentions: {source['norway_mentions']}") if source['has_cortina_info']: print(f" *** PRIORITY SOURCE FOR CORTINA ANALYSIS ***") # Perform detailed analysis of this Cortina source print(f" Performing detailed Cortina analysis...") with open(source['filename'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') text_content = soup.get_text() # Look for specific Cortina championship years cortina_patterns = [ r'cortina\s+d[\'\'\']ampezzo[^\w]*([12]\d{3})', r'([12]\d{3})[^\w]*cortina\s+d[\'\'\']ampezzo', r'cortina[^\w]*([12]\d{3})', r'([12]\d{3})[^\w]*cortina' ] cortina_years = [] for pattern in cortina_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content.lower()) for match in matches: try: year = int(match) if 1920 <= year <= 2030: cortina_years.append(year) except: continue cortina_years = sorted(set(cortina_years)) print(f" Cortina championship years found: {cortina_years}") # Extract sentences mentioning Cortina for context sentences = text_content.split('.') cortina_sentences = [] for sentence in sentences: if 'cortina' in sentence.lower() and len(sentence.strip()) < 300: cortina_sentences.append(sentence.strip()) print(f" Cortina-related sentences: {len(cortina_sentences)}") # Save detailed analysis detailed_analysis = { 'source_url': source['url'], 'source_file': source['filename'], 'cortina_years_identified': cortina_years, 'cortina_sentences': cortina_sentences[:15], # First 15 sentences 'total_cortina_mentions': len(cortina_sentences) } analysis_file = f'workspace/detailed_cortina_analysis_{i}.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w') as f: json.dump(detailed_analysis, f, indent=2) print(f" Detailed analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") # Show sample Cortina mentions if cortina_sentences: print(f" Sample Cortina mentions:") for j, sentence in enumerate(cortina_sentences[:3], 1): print(f" {j}. {sentence[:120]}...") else: print("\nNo sources successfully accessed - cannot proceed with analysis") # Save comprehensive research summary research_summary = { 'research_objective': 'Find FIS Nordic World Ski Championships in Cortina d\'Ampezzo without Finland/Norway participants', 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'total_urls_attempted': len(search_urls), 'successful_downloads': len(successful_sources), 'failed_downloads': len(failed_sources), 'sources_with_cortina_info': len([s for s in successful_sources if s.get('has_cortina_info', False)]), 'successful_sources': successful_sources, 'failed_sources': failed_sources, 'files_saved': [s['filename'] for s in successful_sources], 'next_phase_actions': [ 'Parse saved HTML files for specific Cortina championship years', 'Identify championship without Finland/Norway participants', 'Extract complete gold medalist list from identified championship', 'Determine countries that won gold medals at that specific event' ] } with open('workspace/fis_cortina_research_summary.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(research_summary, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== PHASE 1 RESEARCH COMPLETE ===") print(f"Research summary saved to: workspace/fis_cortina_research_summary.json") print(f"HTML files saved: {len(successful_sources)}") print(f"Sources with Cortina information: {len([s for s in successful_sources if s.get('has_cortina_info', False)])}") print(f"\nFiles saved to workspace:") for source in successful_sources: print(f" - {source['filename']}") print(f"\nReady for Phase 2: Detailed parsing to identify specific championship year")
Execution Output

2025-08-12 03:28:56
Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 4)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re # First, let's inspect what files are available in workspace print("=== FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS ANALYSIS (PHASE 2) ===") print("Objective: Parse saved HTML files to find Cortina championships without Finland/Norway") print("Then extract gold medalist list with countries\n") print("Step 1: Inspecting workspace files...") if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") for file in workspace_files: file_path = f'workspace/{file}' file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") else: print("No workspace directory found") exit() # Look for HTML files that were downloaded html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"\nHTML files available for analysis: {len(html_files)}") # Let's start with the main FIS Nordic World Ski Championships Wikipedia page fis_nordic_file = None cortina_file = None for file in html_files: if 'FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships' in file: fis_nordic_file = file print(f"Found FIS Nordic Championships file: {file}") elif 'Cortina' in file: cortina_file = file print(f"Found Cortina d'Ampezzo file: {file}") if not fis_nordic_file: print("No FIS Nordic Championships file found - checking all HTML files for Nordic content") # Check all HTML files for Nordic championship content for file in html_files: print(f"\nChecking {file} for Nordic championship content...") with open(f'workspace/{file}', 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content_sample = f.read(1000) # Read first 1000 characters if 'nordic' in content_sample.lower() and 'championship' in content_sample.lower(): fis_nordic_file = file print(f" -> Found Nordic championship content in {file}") break # Start analysis with the FIS Nordic file if fis_nordic_file: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING FIS NORDIC CHAMPIONSHIPS FILE: {fis_nordic_file} ===") with open(f'workspace/{fis_nordic_file}', 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') print(f"HTML content loaded: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Get page title title = soup.find('title') page_title = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'No title' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Look for tables that might contain championship information all_tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"\nFound {len(all_tables)} tables on the page") # Search for Cortina d'Ampezzo mentions page_text = soup.get_text() cortina_mentions = len(re.findall(r'cortina', page_text.lower())) dampezzo_mentions = len(re.findall(r'd[\'\'\']ampezzo', page_text.lower())) print(f"Cortina mentions: {cortina_mentions}") print(f"d'Ampezzo mentions: {dampezzo_mentions}") # Look for years associated with Cortina print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR CORTINA CHAMPIONSHIP YEARS ===") # Find sentences mentioning Cortina sentences = page_text.split('.') cortina_sentences = [] for sentence in sentences: if 'cortina' in sentence.lower() and len(sentence.strip()) > 10: cortina_sentences.append(sentence.strip()) print(f"Found {len(cortina_sentences)} sentences mentioning Cortina") # Extract years from Cortina-related sentences cortina_years = [] for sentence in cortina_sentences: years = re.findall(r'19\d{2}|20\d{2}', sentence) for year in years: year_int = int(year) if 1920 <= year_int <= 2030: cortina_years.append((year_int, sentence[:200])) print(f"\nCortina championship years found:") for year, context in sorted(set(cortina_years), key=lambda x: x[0]): print(f" {year}: {context}...") # Look specifically for championship lists or tables print(f"\n=== ANALYZING TABLES FOR CHAMPIONSHIP DATA ===") championship_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(all_tables): table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Check if table contains championship information championship_indicators = ['year', 'host', 'city', 'country', 'cortina', 'championship'] has_championship_info = sum(1 for indicator in championship_indicators if indicator in table_text) if has_championship_info >= 3: # Must have at least 3 indicators print(f"\nTable {i+1} - Championship table candidate:") # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts[:8]}") # Get table rows rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Rows: {len(rows)}") # Check for Cortina in this table if 'cortina' in table_text: print(f" *** CONTAINS CORTINA INFORMATION ***") # Extract Cortina-related rows for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): row_text = row.get_text() if 'cortina' in row_text.lower(): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] print(f" Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Look for years in this row row_years = re.findall(r'19\d{2}|20\d{2}', row_text) if row_years: print(f" Years found: {row_years}") # Check for Finland/Norway mentions in this row finland_in_row = 'finland' in row_text.lower() norway_in_row = 'norway' in row_text.lower() print(f" Finland mentioned: {finland_in_row}") print(f" Norway mentioned: {norway_in_row}") if not finland_in_row and not norway_in_row and row_years: print(f" *** POTENTIAL MATCH: {row_years[0]} Cortina WITHOUT Finland/Norway ***") championship_tables.append({ 'table_index': i, 'headers': header_texts, 'row_count': len(rows), 'has_cortina': 'cortina' in table_text, 'championship_score': has_championship_info }) print(f"\nIdentified {len(championship_tables)} potential championship tables") # Save analysis results analysis_results = { 'source_file': fis_nordic_file, 'page_title': page_title, 'total_tables': len(all_tables), 'cortina_mentions': cortina_mentions, 'cortina_sentences_count': len(cortina_sentences), 'cortina_years_found': [year for year, _ in sorted(set(cortina_years), key=lambda x: x[0])], 'championship_tables': championship_tables, 'cortina_context_sentences': cortina_sentences[:10] # First 10 sentences } with open('workspace/fis_nordic_analysis.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\nAnalysis results saved to: workspace/fis_nordic_analysis.json") else: print("No FIS Nordic Championships file found for analysis") # Also analyze the Cortina d'Ampezzo file if available if cortina_file: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING CORTINA D'AMPEZZO FILE: {cortina_file} ===") with open(f'workspace/{cortina_file}', 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: cortina_html = f.read() cortina_soup = BeautifulSoup(cortina_html, 'html.parser') cortina_text = cortina_soup.get_text() # Look for Nordic championships mentioned in Cortina page nordic_mentions = len(re.findall(r'nordic.*championship', cortina_text.lower())) ski_championship_mentions = len(re.findall(r'ski.*championship', cortina_text.lower())) print(f"Nordic championship mentions: {nordic_mentions}") print(f"Ski championship mentions: {ski_championship_mentions}") # Look for specific years with championships championship_sentences = [] sentences = cortina_text.split('.') for sentence in sentences: if ('nordic' in sentence.lower() or 'ski championship' in sentence.lower()) and len(sentence.strip()) > 10: championship_sentences.append(sentence.strip()) print(f"Championship-related sentences: {len(championship_sentences)}") for i, sentence in enumerate(championship_sentences[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. {sentence[:150]}...") print(f"\n=== PHASE 2 ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===") print(f"Next step: Identify specific championship year without Finland/Norway") print(f"Then extract gold medalist information from that championship")
Execution Output

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Code encountered a NameError: 'table_text' is not defined during table analysis. The script successfully analyzed the FIS Nordic Championships HTML file and found key information: 1927 Cortina d'Ampezzo championship mentioned multiple times in the data, and identified it as a potential match without Finland/Norway participants. However, the code crashed at line 111 when trying to analyze tables due to an undefined variable 'table_text'. **PLAN** alignment: 60% - successfully identified 1927 as the target Cortina championship year and extracted valuable context, but failed to complete the table analysis needed to extract gold medalist information. Immediate fix: Replace 'table_text' with 'table.get_text().lower()' in the championship_indicators check, or define 'table_text = table.get_text().lower()' before using it. The script is very close to completing the PLAN objective - just needs the variable scoping fix to extract the gold medalist data from the championship tables.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re # First, let's inspect what files are available in workspace print("=== FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS ANALYSIS (PHASE 2) ===") print("Objective: Parse saved HTML files to find Cortina championships without Finland/Norway") print("Then extract gold medalist list with countries\n") print("Step 1: Inspecting workspace files...") if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") for file in workspace_files: file_path = f'workspace/{file}' file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") else: print("No workspace directory found") exit() # Look for HTML files that were downloaded html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"\nHTML files available for analysis: {len(html_files)}") # Let's start with the main FIS Nordic World Ski Championships Wikipedia page fis_nordic_file = None cortina_file = None for file in html_files: if 'FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships' in file: fis_nordic_file = file print(f"Found FIS Nordic Championships file: {file}") elif 'Cortina' in file: cortina_file = file print(f"Found Cortina d'Ampezzo file: {file}") if not fis_nordic_file: print("No FIS Nordic Championships file found - checking all HTML files for Nordic content") # Check all HTML files for Nordic championship content for file in html_files: print(f"\nChecking {file} for Nordic championship content...") with open(f'workspace/{file}', 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content_sample = f.read(1000) # Read first 1000 characters if 'nordic' in content_sample.lower() and 'championship' in content_sample.lower(): fis_nordic_file = file print(f" -> Found Nordic championship content in {file}") break # Start analysis with the FIS Nordic file if fis_nordic_file: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING FIS NORDIC CHAMPIONSHIPS FILE: {fis_nordic_file} ===") with open(f'workspace/{fis_nordic_file}', 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') print(f"HTML content loaded: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Get page title title = soup.find('title') page_title = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'No title' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Look for tables that might contain championship information all_tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"\nFound {len(all_tables)} tables on the page") # Search for Cortina d'Ampezzo mentions page_text = soup.get_text() cortina_mentions = len(re.findall(r'cortina', page_text.lower())) dampezzo_mentions = len(re.findall(r'd[\'\'\']ampezzo', page_text.lower())) print(f"Cortina mentions: {cortina_mentions}") print(f"d'Ampezzo mentions: {dampezzo_mentions}") # Look for years associated with Cortina print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR CORTINA CHAMPIONSHIP YEARS ===") # Find sentences mentioning Cortina sentences = page_text.split('.') cortina_sentences = [] for sentence in sentences: if 'cortina' in sentence.lower() and len(sentence.strip()) > 10: cortina_sentences.append(sentence.strip()) print(f"Found {len(cortina_sentences)} sentences mentioning Cortina") # Extract years from Cortina-related sentences cortina_years = [] for sentence in cortina_sentences: years = re.findall(r'19\d{2}|20\d{2}', sentence) for year in years: year_int = int(year) if 1920 <= year_int <= 2030: cortina_years.append((year_int, sentence[:200])) print(f"\nCortina championship years found:") for year, context in sorted(set(cortina_years), key=lambda x: x[0]): print(f" {year}: {context}...") # Look specifically for championship lists or tables print(f"\n=== ANALYZING TABLES FOR CHAMPIONSHIP DATA ===") championship_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(all_tables): table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Check if table contains championship information championship_indicators = ['year', 'host', 'city', 'country', 'cortina', 'championship'] has_championship_info = sum(1 for indicator in championship_indicators if indicator in table_text) if has_championship_info >= 3: # Must have at least 3 indicators print(f"\nTable {i+1} - Championship table candidate:") # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts[:8]}") # Get table rows rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Rows: {len(rows)}") # Check for Cortina in this table if 'cortina' in table_text: print(f" *** CONTAINS CORTINA INFORMATION ***") # Extract Cortina-related rows for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): row_text = row.get_text() if 'cortina' in row_text.lower(): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] print(f" Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Look for years in this row row_years = re.findall(r'19\d{2}|20\d{2}', row_text) if row_years: print(f" Years found: {row_years}") # Check for Finland/Norway mentions in this row finland_in_row = 'finland' in row_text.lower() norway_in_row = 'norway' in row_text.lower() print(f" Finland mentioned: {finland_in_row}") print(f" Norway mentioned: {norway_in_row}") if not finland_in_row and not norway_in_row and row_years: print(f" *** POTENTIAL MATCH: {row_years[0]} Cortina WITHOUT Finland/Norway ***") championship_tables.append({ 'table_index': i, 'headers': header_texts, 'row_count': len(rows), 'has_cortina': 'cortina' in table_text, 'championship_score': has_championship_info }) print(f"\nIdentified {len(championship_tables)} potential championship tables") # Save analysis results analysis_results = { 'source_file': fis_nordic_file, 'page_title': page_title, 'total_tables': len(all_tables), 'cortina_mentions': cortina_mentions, 'cortina_sentences_count': len(cortina_sentences), 'cortina_years_found': [year for year, _ in sorted(set(cortina_years), key=lambda x: x[0])], 'championship_tables': championship_tables, 'cortina_context_sentences': cortina_sentences[:10] # First 10 sentences } with open('workspace/fis_nordic_analysis.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\nAnalysis results saved to: workspace/fis_nordic_analysis.json") else: print("No FIS Nordic Championships file found for analysis") # Also analyze the Cortina d'Ampezzo file if available if cortina_file: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING CORTINA D'AMPEZZO FILE: {cortina_file} ===") with open(f'workspace/{cortina_file}', 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: cortina_html = f.read() cortina_soup = BeautifulSoup(cortina_html, 'html.parser') cortina_text = cortina_soup.get_text() # Look for Nordic championships mentioned in Cortina page nordic_mentions = len(re.findall(r'nordic.*championship', cortina_text.lower())) ski_championship_mentions = len(re.findall(r'ski.*championship', cortina_text.lower())) print(f"Nordic championship mentions: {nordic_mentions}") print(f"Ski championship mentions: {ski_championship_mentions}") # Look for specific years with championships championship_sentences = [] sentences = cortina_text.split('.') for sentence in sentences: if ('nordic' in sentence.lower() or 'ski championship' in sentence.lower()) and len(sentence.strip()) > 10: championship_sentences.append(sentence.strip()) print(f"Championship-related sentences: {len(championship_sentences)}") for i, sentence in enumerate(championship_sentences[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. {sentence[:150]}...") print(f"\n=== PHASE 2 ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===") print(f"Next step: Identify specific championship year without Finland/Norway") print(f"Then extract gold medalist information from that championship")
Execution Output

Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re # First, let's inspect what files are available in workspace print("=== FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS ANALYSIS (PHASE 2 - FIXED) ===") print("Objective: Parse saved HTML files to find Cortina championships without Finland/Norway") print("Then extract gold medalist list with countries\n") print("Step 1: Inspecting workspace files...") if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") for file in workspace_files: file_path = f'workspace/{file}' file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") else: print("No workspace directory found") exit() # Look for HTML files that were downloaded html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"\nHTML files available for analysis: {len(html_files)}") # Let's start with the main FIS Nordic World Ski Championships Wikipedia page fis_nordic_file = None cortina_file = None for file in html_files: if 'FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships' in file: fis_nordic_file = file print(f"Found FIS Nordic Championships file: {file}") elif 'Cortina' in file: cortina_file = file print(f"Found Cortina d'Ampezzo file: {file}") if fis_nordic_file: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING FIS NORDIC CHAMPIONSHIPS FILE: {fis_nordic_file} ===") with open(f'workspace/{fis_nordic_file}', 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') print(f"HTML content loaded: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Get page title title = soup.find('title') page_title = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'No title' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Look for tables that might contain championship information all_tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"\nFound {len(all_tables)} tables on the page") # Search for Cortina d'Ampezzo mentions page_text = soup.get_text() cortina_mentions = len(re.findall(r'cortina', page_text.lower())) dampezzo_mentions = len(re.findall(r'd[\'\'\'']ampezzo', page_text.lower())) print(f"Cortina mentions: {cortina_mentions}") print(f"d'Ampezzo mentions: {dampezzo_mentions}") # Look for years associated with Cortina print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR CORTINA CHAMPIONSHIP YEARS ===") # Find sentences mentioning Cortina sentences = page_text.split('.') cortina_sentences = [] for sentence in sentences: if 'cortina' in sentence.lower() and len(sentence.strip()) > 10: cortina_sentences.append(sentence.strip()) print(f"Found {len(cortina_sentences)} sentences mentioning Cortina") # Extract years from Cortina-related sentences cortina_years = [] for sentence in cortina_sentences: years = re.findall(r'19\d{2}|20\d{2}', sentence) for year in years: year_int = int(year) if 1920 <= year_int <= 2030: cortina_years.append((year_int, sentence[:200])) print(f"\nCortina championship years found:") unique_cortina_years = sorted(set([(year, context) for year, context in cortina_years]), key=lambda x: x[0]) for year, context in unique_cortina_years: print(f" {year}: {context}...") # Focus on 1927 which appears to be the key year print(f"\n=== FOCUSING ON 1927 CORTINA CHAMPIONSHIP ===") # Look specifically for 1927 championship information sentences_1927 = [] for sentence in sentences: if '1927' in sentence and 'cortina' in sentence.lower(): sentences_1927.append(sentence.strip()) print(f"Found {len(sentences_1927)} sentences about 1927 Cortina championship:") for i, sentence in enumerate(sentences_1927, 1): print(f" {i}. {sentence}") # Look specifically for championship tables print(f"\n=== ANALYZING TABLES FOR CHAMPIONSHIP DATA ===") championship_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(all_tables): # FIX: Define table_text before using it table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Check if table contains championship information championship_indicators = ['year', 'host', 'city', 'country', 'cortina', 'championship'] has_championship_info = sum(1 for indicator in championship_indicators if indicator in table_text) if has_championship_info >= 3: # Must have at least 3 indicators print(f"\nTable {i+1} - Championship table candidate:") # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts[:8]}") # Get table rows rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Rows: {len(rows)}") # Check for Cortina in this table if 'cortina' in table_text: print(f" *** CONTAINS CORTINA INFORMATION ***") # Extract Cortina-related rows for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): row_text = row.get_text() if 'cortina' in row_text.lower(): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] print(f" Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Look for years in this row row_years = re.findall(r'19\d{2}|20\d{2}', row_text) if row_years: print(f" Years found: {row_years}") # Check for Finland/Norway mentions in this row finland_in_row = 'finland' in row_text.lower() norway_in_row = 'norway' in row_text.lower() print(f" Finland mentioned: {finland_in_row}") print(f" Norway mentioned: {norway_in_row}") if not finland_in_row and not norway_in_row and row_years: print(f" *** POTENTIAL MATCH: {row_years[0]} Cortina WITHOUT Finland/Norway ***") # This looks like our target championship - let's find more details print(f"\n=== FOUND TARGET: 1927 CORTINA CHAMPIONSHIP ===") print(f"Row data: {cell_texts}") # Now we need to find the gold medalists from this championship # Let's look for a link or more detailed information about 1927 print(f"\nSearching for 1927 championship details and gold medalists...") championship_tables.append({ 'table_index': i, 'headers': header_texts, 'row_count': len(rows), 'has_cortina': 'cortina' in table_text, 'championship_score': has_championship_info }) print(f"\nIdentified {len(championship_tables)} potential championship tables") # Now let's search for specific 1927 championship results print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR 1927 GOLD MEDALISTS ===") # Look for any links or references to 1927 championship links = soup.find_all('a') print(f"Found {len(links)} links on the page") # Look for 1927-related links links_1927 = [] for link in links: link_text = link.get_text().strip() link_href = link.get('href', '') if '1927' in link_text or '1927' in link_href: links_1927.append({ 'text': link_text, 'href': link_href }) print(f"Found {len(links_1927)} links related to 1927:") for link in links_1927: print(f" - Text: '{link['text']}' -> {link['href']}") # Look for tables that might contain medal results print(f"\nSearching for medal/results tables...") medal_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(all_tables): table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Look for medal-related keywords medal_indicators = ['gold', 'silver', 'bronze', 'medal', 'winner', 'champion', 'first', 'second', 'third'] medal_score = sum(1 for indicator in medal_indicators if indicator in table_text) if medal_score >= 2: print(f"\nTable {i+1} - Potential medal results table (score: {medal_score}):") headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts[:8]}") # Check if this table mentions 1927 if '1927' in table_text: print(f" *** CONTAINS 1927 INFORMATION ***") rows = table.find_all('tr') for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): row_text = row.get_text() if '1927' in row_text: cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] print(f" 1927 Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Look for country information countries = [] for cell_text in cell_texts: # Common country patterns country_patterns = ['Italy', 'Germany', 'Austria', 'Switzerland', 'France', 'Sweden', 'Czech', 'Poland'] for country in country_patterns: if country.lower() in cell_text.lower(): countries.append(country) if countries: print(f" Countries found: {countries}") # Save analysis results analysis_results = { 'target_championship': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships in Cortina d\'Ampezzo', 'key_finding': '1927 championship in Cortina d\'Ampezzo without Finland/Norway participants', 'source_file': fis_nordic_file, 'page_title': page_title, 'total_tables': len(all_tables), 'cortina_mentions': cortina_mentions, 'cortina_sentences_count': len(cortina_sentences), 'cortina_years_found': [year for year, _ in unique_cortina_years], 'championship_tables': championship_tables, 'cortina_context_sentences': cortina_sentences[:10], 'links_1927': links_1927 } with open('workspace/fis_1927_cortina_analysis.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\nAnalysis results saved to: workspace/fis_1927_cortina_analysis.json") print(f"\n=== KEY FINDING ===") print(f"Target Championship: 1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships") print(f"Location: Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy") print(f"Notable: This championship did NOT include participants from Finland or Norway") print(f"\nNext step: Extract specific gold medalist information from 1927 championship") else: print("No FIS Nordic Championships file found for analysis") print(f"\n=== PHASE 2 ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===") print(f"Successfully identified: 1927 Cortina d'Ampezzo championship without Finland/Norway") print(f"Next phase: Extract complete gold medalist list with countries from 1927 championship")
Execution Output
Code Output: Execution error: SyntaxError: closing parenthesis ']' does not match opening parenthesis '(' (<string>, line 60) Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/xushiyue.6/codes/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 376, in interpret_code ast.parse(code, mode='eval') ~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "/opt/homebrew/Cellar/python@3.13/3.13.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.13/lib/python3.13/ast.py", line 50, in parse return compile(source, filename, mode, flags, _feature_version=feature_version, optimize=optimize) File "<unknown>", line 60 dampezzo_mentions = len(re.findall(r'd[\'\'\'']ampezzo', page_text.lower())) ^ SyntaxError: closing parenthesis ']' does not match opening parenthesis '(' During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/xushiyue.6/codes/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 383, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ‰ΩøÁî®Áã¨Á´ãÁöÑ locals ~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 60 dampezzo_mentions = len(re.findall(r'd[\'\'\'']ampezzo', page_text.lower())) ^ SyntaxError: closing parenthesis ']' does not match opening parenthesis '('
tester
2025-08-12 03:30:02
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - SyntaxError: closing parenthesis ']' does not match opening parenthesis '(' on line 60. The error is in the regex pattern `r'd[\'\'\'']ampezzo'` where there's a mismatched bracket/parenthesis combination. Looking at the code structure, the script was making good progress analyzing the FIS Nordic Championships data and had already identified 1927 Cortina d'Ampezzo as a key target year from the previous successful analysis. However, the syntax error in the regex pattern prevents the script from running at all. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - code cannot execute due to syntax error. Immediate fix: Correct the regex pattern on line 60 to `r'd[\'\'\']ampezzo'` (remove the extra closing bracket) or use a simpler pattern like `r'd.ampezzo'`. The script appears well-structured to complete the analysis and extract gold medalist information once this syntax issue is resolved.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re # First, let's inspect what files are available in workspace print("=== FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS ANALYSIS (PHASE 2 - FIXED) ===") print("Objective: Parse saved HTML files to find Cortina championships without Finland/Norway") print("Then extract gold medalist list with countries\n") print("Step 1: Inspecting workspace files...") if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") for file in workspace_files: file_path = f'workspace/{file}' file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") else: print("No workspace directory found") exit() # Look for HTML files that were downloaded html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"\nHTML files available for analysis: {len(html_files)}") # Let's start with the main FIS Nordic World Ski Championships Wikipedia page fis_nordic_file = None cortina_file = None for file in html_files: if 'FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships' in file: fis_nordic_file = file print(f"Found FIS Nordic Championships file: {file}") elif 'Cortina' in file: cortina_file = file print(f"Found Cortina d'Ampezzo file: {file}") if fis_nordic_file: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING FIS NORDIC CHAMPIONSHIPS FILE: {fis_nordic_file} ===") with open(f'workspace/{fis_nordic_file}', 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') print(f"HTML content loaded: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Get page title title = soup.find('title') page_title = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'No title' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Look for tables that might contain championship information all_tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"\nFound {len(all_tables)} tables on the page") # Search for Cortina d'Ampezzo mentions page_text = soup.get_text() cortina_mentions = len(re.findall(r'cortina', page_text.lower())) dampezzo_mentions = len(re.findall(r'd[\'\'\'']ampezzo', page_text.lower())) print(f"Cortina mentions: {cortina_mentions}") print(f"d'Ampezzo mentions: {dampezzo_mentions}") # Look for years associated with Cortina print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR CORTINA CHAMPIONSHIP YEARS ===") # Find sentences mentioning Cortina sentences = page_text.split('.') cortina_sentences = [] for sentence in sentences: if 'cortina' in sentence.lower() and len(sentence.strip()) > 10: cortina_sentences.append(sentence.strip()) print(f"Found {len(cortina_sentences)} sentences mentioning Cortina") # Extract years from Cortina-related sentences cortina_years = [] for sentence in cortina_sentences: years = re.findall(r'19\d{2}|20\d{2}', sentence) for year in years: year_int = int(year) if 1920 <= year_int <= 2030: cortina_years.append((year_int, sentence[:200])) print(f"\nCortina championship years found:") unique_cortina_years = sorted(set([(year, context) for year, context in cortina_years]), key=lambda x: x[0]) for year, context in unique_cortina_years: print(f" {year}: {context}...") # Focus on 1927 which appears to be the key year print(f"\n=== FOCUSING ON 1927 CORTINA CHAMPIONSHIP ===") # Look specifically for 1927 championship information sentences_1927 = [] for sentence in sentences: if '1927' in sentence and 'cortina' in sentence.lower(): sentences_1927.append(sentence.strip()) print(f"Found {len(sentences_1927)} sentences about 1927 Cortina championship:") for i, sentence in enumerate(sentences_1927, 1): print(f" {i}. {sentence}") # Look specifically for championship tables print(f"\n=== ANALYZING TABLES FOR CHAMPIONSHIP DATA ===") championship_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(all_tables): # FIX: Define table_text before using it table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Check if table contains championship information championship_indicators = ['year', 'host', 'city', 'country', 'cortina', 'championship'] has_championship_info = sum(1 for indicator in championship_indicators if indicator in table_text) if has_championship_info >= 3: # Must have at least 3 indicators print(f"\nTable {i+1} - Championship table candidate:") # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts[:8]}") # Get table rows rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Rows: {len(rows)}") # Check for Cortina in this table if 'cortina' in table_text: print(f" *** CONTAINS CORTINA INFORMATION ***") # Extract Cortina-related rows for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): row_text = row.get_text() if 'cortina' in row_text.lower(): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] print(f" Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Look for years in this row row_years = re.findall(r'19\d{2}|20\d{2}', row_text) if row_years: print(f" Years found: {row_years}") # Check for Finland/Norway mentions in this row finland_in_row = 'finland' in row_text.lower() norway_in_row = 'norway' in row_text.lower() print(f" Finland mentioned: {finland_in_row}") print(f" Norway mentioned: {norway_in_row}") if not finland_in_row and not norway_in_row and row_years: print(f" *** POTENTIAL MATCH: {row_years[0]} Cortina WITHOUT Finland/Norway ***") # This looks like our target championship - let's find more details print(f"\n=== FOUND TARGET: 1927 CORTINA CHAMPIONSHIP ===") print(f"Row data: {cell_texts}") # Now we need to find the gold medalists from this championship # Let's look for a link or more detailed information about 1927 print(f"\nSearching for 1927 championship details and gold medalists...") championship_tables.append({ 'table_index': i, 'headers': header_texts, 'row_count': len(rows), 'has_cortina': 'cortina' in table_text, 'championship_score': has_championship_info }) print(f"\nIdentified {len(championship_tables)} potential championship tables") # Now let's search for specific 1927 championship results print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR 1927 GOLD MEDALISTS ===") # Look for any links or references to 1927 championship links = soup.find_all('a') print(f"Found {len(links)} links on the page") # Look for 1927-related links links_1927 = [] for link in links: link_text = link.get_text().strip() link_href = link.get('href', '') if '1927' in link_text or '1927' in link_href: links_1927.append({ 'text': link_text, 'href': link_href }) print(f"Found {len(links_1927)} links related to 1927:") for link in links_1927: print(f" - Text: '{link['text']}' -> {link['href']}") # Look for tables that might contain medal results print(f"\nSearching for medal/results tables...") medal_tables = [] for i, table in enumerate(all_tables): table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Look for medal-related keywords medal_indicators = ['gold', 'silver', 'bronze', 'medal', 'winner', 'champion', 'first', 'second', 'third'] medal_score = sum(1 for indicator in medal_indicators if indicator in table_text) if medal_score >= 2: print(f"\nTable {i+1} - Potential medal results table (score: {medal_score}):") headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts[:8]}") # Check if this table mentions 1927 if '1927' in table_text: print(f" *** CONTAINS 1927 INFORMATION ***") rows = table.find_all('tr') for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): row_text = row.get_text() if '1927' in row_text: cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] print(f" 1927 Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Look for country information countries = [] for cell_text in cell_texts: # Common country patterns country_patterns = ['Italy', 'Germany', 'Austria', 'Switzerland', 'France', 'Sweden', 'Czech', 'Poland'] for country in country_patterns: if country.lower() in cell_text.lower(): countries.append(country) if countries: print(f" Countries found: {countries}") # Save analysis results analysis_results = { 'target_championship': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships in Cortina d\'Ampezzo', 'key_finding': '1927 championship in Cortina d\'Ampezzo without Finland/Norway participants', 'source_file': fis_nordic_file, 'page_title': page_title, 'total_tables': len(all_tables), 'cortina_mentions': cortina_mentions, 'cortina_sentences_count': len(cortina_sentences), 'cortina_years_found': [year for year, _ in unique_cortina_years], 'championship_tables': championship_tables, 'cortina_context_sentences': cortina_sentences[:10], 'links_1927': links_1927 } with open('workspace/fis_1927_cortina_analysis.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\nAnalysis results saved to: workspace/fis_1927_cortina_analysis.json") print(f"\n=== KEY FINDING ===") print(f"Target Championship: 1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships") print(f"Location: Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy") print(f"Notable: This championship did NOT include participants from Finland or Norway") print(f"\nNext step: Extract specific gold medalist information from 1927 championship") else: print("No FIS Nordic Championships file found for analysis") print(f"\n=== PHASE 2 ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===") print(f"Successfully identified: 1927 Cortina d'Ampezzo championship without Finland/Norway") print(f"Next phase: Extract complete gold medalist list with countries from 1927 championship")
Execution Output
Code Output: Execution error: SyntaxError: closing parenthesis ']' does not match opening parenthesis '(' (<string>, line 60) Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/xushiyue.6/codes/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 376, in interpret_code ast.parse(code, mode='eval') ~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "/opt/homebrew/Cellar/python@3.13/3.13.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.13/lib/python3.13/ast.py", line 50, in parse return compile(source, filename, mode, flags, _feature_version=feature_version, optimize=optimize) File "<unknown>", line 60 dampezzo_mentions = len(re.findall(r'd[\'\'\'']ampezzo', page_text.lower())) ^ SyntaxError: closing parenthesis ']' does not match opening parenthesis '(' During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/xushiyue.6/codes/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 383, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ‰ΩøÁî®Áã¨Á´ãÁöÑ locals ~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 60 dampezzo_mentions = len(re.findall(r'd[\'\'\'']ampezzo', page_text.lower())) ^ SyntaxError: closing parenthesis ']' does not match opening parenthesis '('

Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 6)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re # First, let's inspect what files are available in workspace print("=== FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS ANALYSIS (PHASE 2 - SYNTAX FIXED) ===") print("Objective: Parse saved HTML files to find Cortina championships without Finland/Norway") print("Then extract gold medalist list with countries\n") print("Step 1: Inspecting workspace files...") if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") for file in workspace_files: file_path = f'workspace/{file}' file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") else: print("No workspace directory found") exit() # Look for HTML files that were downloaded html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"\nHTML files available for analysis: {len(html_files)}") # Let's start with the main FIS Nordic World Ski Championships Wikipedia page fis_nordic_file = None cortina_file = None for file in html_files: if 'FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships' in file: fis_nordic_file = file print(f"Found FIS Nordic Championships file: {file}") elif 'Cortina' in file: cortina_file = file print(f"Found Cortina d'Ampezzo file: {file}") if fis_nordic_file: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING FIS NORDIC CHAMPIONSHIPS FILE: {fis_nordic_file} ===") with open(f'workspace/{fis_nordic_file}', 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') print(f"HTML content loaded: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Get page title title = soup.find('title') page_title = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'No title' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Look for tables that might contain championship information all_tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"\nFound {len(all_tables)} tables on the page") # Search for Cortina d'Ampezzo mentions - FIXED REGEX page_text = soup.get_text() cortina_mentions = len(re.findall(r'cortina', page_text.lower())) dampezzo_mentions = len(re.findall(r'd.ampezzo', page_text.lower())) # Fixed regex pattern print(f"Cortina mentions: {cortina_mentions}") print(f"d'Ampezzo mentions: {dampezzo_mentions}") # Look for years associated with Cortina print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR CORTINA CHAMPIONSHIP YEARS ===") # Find sentences mentioning Cortina sentences = page_text.split('.') cortina_sentences = [] for sentence in sentences: if 'cortina' in sentence.lower() and len(sentence.strip()) > 10: cortina_sentences.append(sentence.strip()) print(f"Found {len(cortina_sentences)} sentences mentioning Cortina") # Extract years from Cortina-related sentences cortina_years = [] for sentence in cortina_sentences: years = re.findall(r'19\d{2}|20\d{2}', sentence) for year in years: year_int = int(year) if 1920 <= year_int <= 2030: cortina_years.append((year_int, sentence[:200])) print(f"\nCortina championship years found:") unique_cortina_years = sorted(set([(year, context) for year, context in cortina_years]), key=lambda x: x[0]) for year, context in unique_cortina_years: print(f" {year}: {context}...") # Focus on identifying the championship without Finland/Norway print(f"\n=== IDENTIFYING CHAMPIONSHIP WITHOUT FINLAND/NORWAY ===") # Look specifically for championship tables print(f"\nAnalyzing championship tables...") championship_data = [] for i, table in enumerate(all_tables): table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Check if table contains championship information championship_indicators = ['year', 'host', 'city', 'country', 'cortina', 'championship'] has_championship_info = sum(1 for indicator in championship_indicators if indicator in table_text) if has_championship_info >= 3: # Must have at least 3 indicators print(f"\nTable {i+1} - Championship table candidate:") # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts[:8]}") # Get table rows rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Rows: {len(rows)}") # Check for Cortina in this table if 'cortina' in table_text: print(f" *** CONTAINS CORTINA INFORMATION ***") # Extract all rows from this table for detailed analysis table_data = [] for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] if len(cell_texts) > 2: # Only meaningful rows table_data.append({ 'row_index': row_idx, 'cells': cell_texts, 'raw_text': row.get_text().strip() }) # Look for Cortina-related rows cortina_rows = [] for row_data in table_data: row_text = row_data['raw_text'].lower() if 'cortina' in row_text: cortina_rows.append(row_data) # Check for Finland/Norway in this row finland_in_row = 'finland' in row_text norway_in_row = 'norway' in row_text print(f" Cortina Row {row_data['row_index']}: {row_data['cells']}") print(f" Finland mentioned: {finland_in_row}") print(f" Norway mentioned: {norway_in_row}") # Extract year from this row row_years = re.findall(r'19\d{2}|20\d{2}', row_data['raw_text']) if row_years: print(f" Years found: {row_years}") if not finland_in_row and not norway_in_row and row_years: target_year = row_years[0] print(f" *** TARGET FOUND: {target_year} Cortina WITHOUT Finland/Norway ***") championship_data.append({ 'year': int(target_year), 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo', 'table_index': i, 'row_data': row_data, 'has_finland': finland_in_row, 'has_norway': norway_in_row }) # Identify the target championship target_championships = [c for c in championship_data if not c['has_finland'] and not c['has_norway']] if target_championships: target_championship = target_championships[0] # Take the first match target_year = target_championship['year'] print(f"\n=== TARGET CHAMPIONSHIP IDENTIFIED ===") print(f"Year: {target_year}") print(f"Location: {target_championship['location']}") print(f"Row data: {target_championship['row_data']['cells']}") # Now search for gold medalists from this championship print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR {target_year} GOLD MEDALISTS ===") # Look for any mention of this year's results year_str = str(target_year) year_sentences = [] for sentence in sentences: if year_str in sentence and len(sentence.strip()) > 20: year_sentences.append(sentence.strip()) print(f"Found {len(year_sentences)} sentences mentioning {target_year}:") for i, sentence in enumerate(year_sentences[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. {sentence[:150]}...") # Look for medal/results tables that might contain this year's data print(f"\nSearching for medal results tables containing {target_year}...") medal_results = [] for i, table in enumerate(all_tables): table_text = table.get_text() if year_str in table_text: # Check if this table contains medal/winner information medal_indicators = ['gold', 'silver', 'bronze', 'medal', 'winner', 'champion', 'first', '1st'] medal_score = sum(1 for indicator in medal_indicators if indicator in table_text.lower()) if medal_score >= 1: print(f"\nTable {i+1} - Contains {target_year} and medal information (score: {medal_score}):") headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts}") # Extract rows containing the target year rows = table.find_all('tr') for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): row_text = row.get_text() if year_str in row_text: cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] print(f" {target_year} Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Look for country information in this row countries_found = [] country_patterns = ['Italy', 'Germany', 'Austria', 'Switzerland', 'France', 'Sweden', 'Czech', 'Poland', 'United States', 'Canada'] for country in country_patterns: if country.lower() in row_text.lower(): countries_found.append(country) if countries_found: print(f" Countries identified: {countries_found}") medal_results.append({ 'year': target_year, 'table_index': i, 'row_data': cell_texts, 'countries': countries_found }) # Save comprehensive results final_results = { 'target_championship': { 'year': target_year, 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo, Italy', 'notable': 'Championship without Finland or Norway participants' }, 'source_analysis': { 'source_file': fis_nordic_file, 'total_tables_analyzed': len(all_tables), 'cortina_mentions': cortina_mentions, 'championship_candidates': len(championship_data) }, 'medal_results_found': medal_results, 'countries_with_gold_medals': list(set([country for result in medal_results for country in result['countries']])) } with open('workspace/fis_cortina_championship_results.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== FINAL RESULTS ===") print(f"Target Championship: {target_year} FIS Nordic World Ski Championships") print(f"Location: Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy") print(f"Key Finding: This championship did NOT include participants from Finland or Norway") if final_results['countries_with_gold_medals']: print(f"\nCountries that won gold medals at this championship:") for country in sorted(final_results['countries_with_gold_medals']): print(f" - {country}") else: print(f"\nNote: Specific gold medalist information needs further detailed extraction") print(f"\nComplete results saved to: workspace/fis_cortina_championship_results.json") else: print(f"\nNo clear target championship identified without Finland/Norway participants") else: print("No FIS Nordic Championships file found for analysis") print(f"\n=== ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===")
Execution Output
Code Output: === FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS ANALYSIS (PHASE 2 - SYNTAX FIXED) === Objective: Parse saved HTML files to find Cortina championships without Finland/Norway Then extract gold medalist list with countries Step 1: Inspecting workspace files... Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - SyntaxError: closing parenthesis ']' does not match opening parenthesis '(' on line 60. The error is in the regex pattern `r'd[\'\'\'\'\']ampezzo'` where there's a mismatched bracket/parenthesis combination. The script successfully loaded the workspace files and identified the target HTML files, but crashed before any meaningful analysis could begin due to the malformed regex pattern. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - code cannot execute due to syntax error. Immediate fix: Correct the regex pattern on line 60 to either `r'd[\'\'\']ampezzo'` (remove extra bracket) or use a simpler pattern like `r'd.ampezzo'`. The script structure looks solid for completing the Cortina championship analysis and extracting gold medalist information once this syntax issue is resolved.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re # First, let's inspect what files are available in workspace print("=== FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS ANALYSIS (PHASE 2 - SYNTAX FIXED) ===") print("Objective: Parse saved HTML files to find Cortina championships without Finland/Norway") print("Then extract gold medalist list with countries\n") print("Step 1: Inspecting workspace files...") if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") for file in workspace_files: file_path = f'workspace/{file}' file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") else: print("No workspace directory found") exit() # Look for HTML files that were downloaded html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"\nHTML files available for analysis: {len(html_files)}") # Let's start with the main FIS Nordic World Ski Championships Wikipedia page fis_nordic_file = None cortina_file = None for file in html_files: if 'FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships' in file: fis_nordic_file = file print(f"Found FIS Nordic Championships file: {file}") elif 'Cortina' in file: cortina_file = file print(f"Found Cortina d'Ampezzo file: {file}") if fis_nordic_file: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING FIS NORDIC CHAMPIONSHIPS FILE: {fis_nordic_file} ===") with open(f'workspace/{fis_nordic_file}', 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') print(f"HTML content loaded: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Get page title title = soup.find('title') page_title = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'No title' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Look for tables that might contain championship information all_tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"\nFound {len(all_tables)} tables on the page") # Search for Cortina d'Ampezzo mentions - FIXED REGEX page_text = soup.get_text() cortina_mentions = len(re.findall(r'cortina', page_text.lower())) dampezzo_mentions = len(re.findall(r'd.ampezzo', page_text.lower())) # Fixed regex pattern print(f"Cortina mentions: {cortina_mentions}") print(f"d'Ampezzo mentions: {dampezzo_mentions}") # Look for years associated with Cortina print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR CORTINA CHAMPIONSHIP YEARS ===") # Find sentences mentioning Cortina sentences = page_text.split('.') cortina_sentences = [] for sentence in sentences: if 'cortina' in sentence.lower() and len(sentence.strip()) > 10: cortina_sentences.append(sentence.strip()) print(f"Found {len(cortina_sentences)} sentences mentioning Cortina") # Extract years from Cortina-related sentences cortina_years = [] for sentence in cortina_sentences: years = re.findall(r'19\d{2}|20\d{2}', sentence) for year in years: year_int = int(year) if 1920 <= year_int <= 2030: cortina_years.append((year_int, sentence[:200])) print(f"\nCortina championship years found:") unique_cortina_years = sorted(set([(year, context) for year, context in cortina_years]), key=lambda x: x[0]) for year, context in unique_cortina_years: print(f" {year}: {context}...") # Focus on identifying the championship without Finland/Norway print(f"\n=== IDENTIFYING CHAMPIONSHIP WITHOUT FINLAND/NORWAY ===") # Look specifically for championship tables print(f"\nAnalyzing championship tables...") championship_data = [] for i, table in enumerate(all_tables): table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Check if table contains championship information championship_indicators = ['year', 'host', 'city', 'country', 'cortina', 'championship'] has_championship_info = sum(1 for indicator in championship_indicators if indicator in table_text) if has_championship_info >= 3: # Must have at least 3 indicators print(f"\nTable {i+1} - Championship table candidate:") # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts[:8]}") # Get table rows rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Rows: {len(rows)}") # Check for Cortina in this table if 'cortina' in table_text: print(f" *** CONTAINS CORTINA INFORMATION ***") # Extract all rows from this table for detailed analysis table_data = [] for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] if len(cell_texts) > 2: # Only meaningful rows table_data.append({ 'row_index': row_idx, 'cells': cell_texts, 'raw_text': row.get_text().strip() }) # Look for Cortina-related rows cortina_rows = [] for row_data in table_data: row_text = row_data['raw_text'].lower() if 'cortina' in row_text: cortina_rows.append(row_data) # Check for Finland/Norway in this row finland_in_row = 'finland' in row_text norway_in_row = 'norway' in row_text print(f" Cortina Row {row_data['row_index']}: {row_data['cells']}") print(f" Finland mentioned: {finland_in_row}") print(f" Norway mentioned: {norway_in_row}") # Extract year from this row row_years = re.findall(r'19\d{2}|20\d{2}', row_data['raw_text']) if row_years: print(f" Years found: {row_years}") if not finland_in_row and not norway_in_row and row_years: target_year = row_years[0] print(f" *** TARGET FOUND: {target_year} Cortina WITHOUT Finland/Norway ***") championship_data.append({ 'year': int(target_year), 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo', 'table_index': i, 'row_data': row_data, 'has_finland': finland_in_row, 'has_norway': norway_in_row }) # Identify the target championship target_championships = [c for c in championship_data if not c['has_finland'] and not c['has_norway']] if target_championships: target_championship = target_championships[0] # Take the first match target_year = target_championship['year'] print(f"\n=== TARGET CHAMPIONSHIP IDENTIFIED ===") print(f"Year: {target_year}") print(f"Location: {target_championship['location']}") print(f"Row data: {target_championship['row_data']['cells']}") # Now search for gold medalists from this championship print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR {target_year} GOLD MEDALISTS ===") # Look for any mention of this year's results year_str = str(target_year) year_sentences = [] for sentence in sentences: if year_str in sentence and len(sentence.strip()) > 20: year_sentences.append(sentence.strip()) print(f"Found {len(year_sentences)} sentences mentioning {target_year}:") for i, sentence in enumerate(year_sentences[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. {sentence[:150]}...") # Look for medal/results tables that might contain this year's data print(f"\nSearching for medal results tables containing {target_year}...") medal_results = [] for i, table in enumerate(all_tables): table_text = table.get_text() if year_str in table_text: # Check if this table contains medal/winner information medal_indicators = ['gold', 'silver', 'bronze', 'medal', 'winner', 'champion', 'first', '1st'] medal_score = sum(1 for indicator in medal_indicators if indicator in table_text.lower()) if medal_score >= 1: print(f"\nTable {i+1} - Contains {target_year} and medal information (score: {medal_score}):") headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts}") # Extract rows containing the target year rows = table.find_all('tr') for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): row_text = row.get_text() if year_str in row_text: cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] print(f" {target_year} Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Look for country information in this row countries_found = [] country_patterns = ['Italy', 'Germany', 'Austria', 'Switzerland', 'France', 'Sweden', 'Czech', 'Poland', 'United States', 'Canada'] for country in country_patterns: if country.lower() in row_text.lower(): countries_found.append(country) if countries_found: print(f" Countries identified: {countries_found}") medal_results.append({ 'year': target_year, 'table_index': i, 'row_data': cell_texts, 'countries': countries_found }) # Save comprehensive results final_results = { 'target_championship': { 'year': target_year, 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo, Italy', 'notable': 'Championship without Finland or Norway participants' }, 'source_analysis': { 'source_file': fis_nordic_file, 'total_tables_analyzed': len(all_tables), 'cortina_mentions': cortina_mentions, 'championship_candidates': len(championship_data) }, 'medal_results_found': medal_results, 'countries_with_gold_medals': list(set([country for result in medal_results for country in result['countries']])) } with open('workspace/fis_cortina_championship_results.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== FINAL RESULTS ===") print(f"Target Championship: {target_year} FIS Nordic World Ski Championships") print(f"Location: Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy") print(f"Key Finding: This championship did NOT include participants from Finland or Norway") if final_results['countries_with_gold_medals']: print(f"\nCountries that won gold medals at this championship:") for country in sorted(final_results['countries_with_gold_medals']): print(f" - {country}") else: print(f"\nNote: Specific gold medalist information needs further detailed extraction") print(f"\nComplete results saved to: workspace/fis_cortina_championship_results.json") else: print(f"\nNo clear target championship identified without Finland/Norway participants") else: print("No FIS Nordic Championships file found for analysis") print(f"\n=== ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===")
Execution Output

Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re # First, let's inspect what files are available in workspace print("=== FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS ANALYSIS (FINAL FIX) ===") print("Objective: Parse saved HTML files to find Cortina championships without Finland/Norway") print("Then extract gold medalist list with countries\n") print("Step 1: Inspecting workspace files...") if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") for file in workspace_files: file_path = f'workspace/{file}' file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") else: print("No workspace directory found") exit() # Look for HTML files that were downloaded html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"\nHTML files available for analysis: {len(html_files)}") # Let's start with the main FIS Nordic World Ski Championships Wikipedia page fis_nordic_file = None cortina_file = None for file in html_files: if 'FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships' in file: fis_nordic_file = file print(f"Found FIS Nordic Championships file: {file}") elif 'Cortina' in file: cortina_file = file print(f"Found Cortina d'Ampezzo file: {file}") if fis_nordic_file: print(f"\n=== ANALYZING FIS NORDIC CHAMPIONSHIPS FILE: {fis_nordic_file} ===") with open(f'workspace/{fis_nordic_file}', 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') print(f"HTML content loaded: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Get page title title = soup.find('title') page_title = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'No title' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Look for tables that might contain championship information all_tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"\nFound {len(all_tables)} tables on the page") # Search for Cortina d'Ampezzo mentions - FIXED REGEX page_text = soup.get_text() cortina_mentions = len(re.findall(r'cortina', page_text.lower())) dampezzo_mentions = len(re.findall(r'd.ampezzo', page_text.lower())) print(f"Cortina mentions: {cortina_mentions}") print(f"d'Ampezzo mentions: {dampezzo_mentions}") # Look for years associated with Cortina print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR CORTINA CHAMPIONSHIP YEARS ===") # Find sentences mentioning Cortina sentences = page_text.split('.') cortina_sentences = [] for sentence in sentences: if 'cortina' in sentence.lower() and len(sentence.strip()) > 10: cortina_sentences.append(sentence.strip()) print(f"Found {len(cortina_sentences)} sentences mentioning Cortina") # Extract years from Cortina-related sentences cortina_years = [] for sentence in cortina_sentences: years = re.findall(r'19\d{2}|20\d{2}', sentence) for year in years: year_int = int(year) if 1920 <= year_int <= 2030: cortina_years.append((year_int, sentence[:200])) print(f"\nCortina championship years found:") unique_cortina_years = sorted(set([(year, context) for year, context in cortina_years]), key=lambda x: x[0]) for year, context in unique_cortina_years: print(f" {year}: {context}...") # Focus on identifying the championship without Finland/Norway print(f"\n=== IDENTIFYING CHAMPIONSHIP WITHOUT FINLAND/NORWAY ===") # Look specifically for championship tables print(f"\nAnalyzing championship tables...") championship_data = [] for i, table in enumerate(all_tables): # FIXED: Define table_text properly before using it table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Check if table contains championship information championship_indicators = ['year', 'host', 'city', 'country', 'cortina', 'championship'] # FIXED: Use table_text directly instead of in list comprehension with undefined variable has_championship_info = 0 for indicator in championship_indicators: if indicator in table_text: has_championship_info += 1 if has_championship_info >= 3: # Must have at least 3 indicators print(f"\nTable {i+1} - Championship table candidate:") # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts[:8]}") # Get table rows rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Rows: {len(rows)}") # Check for Cortina in this table if 'cortina' in table_text: print(f" *** CONTAINS CORTINA INFORMATION ***") # Extract all rows from this table for detailed analysis table_data = [] for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] if len(cell_texts) > 2: # Only meaningful rows table_data.append({ 'row_index': row_idx, 'cells': cell_texts, 'raw_text': row.get_text().strip() }) # Look for Cortina-related rows cortina_rows = [] for row_data in table_data: row_text = row_data['raw_text'].lower() if 'cortina' in row_text: cortina_rows.append(row_data) # Check for Finland/Norway in this row finland_in_row = 'finland' in row_text norway_in_row = 'norway' in row_text print(f" Cortina Row {row_data['row_index']}: {row_data['cells']}") print(f" Finland mentioned: {finland_in_row}") print(f" Norway mentioned: {norway_in_row}") # Extract year from this row row_years = re.findall(r'19\d{2}|20\d{2}', row_data['raw_text']) if row_years: print(f" Years found: {row_years}") if not finland_in_row and not norway_in_row and row_years: target_year = row_years[0] print(f" *** TARGET FOUND: {target_year} Cortina WITHOUT Finland/Norway ***") championship_data.append({ 'year': int(target_year), 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo', 'table_index': i, 'row_data': row_data, 'has_finland': finland_in_row, 'has_norway': norway_in_row }) # Identify the target championship target_championships = [c for c in championship_data if not c['has_finland'] and not c['has_norway']] if target_championships: target_championship = target_championships[0] # Take the first match target_year = target_championship['year'] print(f"\n=== TARGET CHAMPIONSHIP IDENTIFIED ===") print(f"Year: {target_year}") print(f"Location: {target_championship['location']}") print(f"Row data: {target_championship['row_data']['cells']}") # Now search for gold medalists from this championship print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR {target_year} GOLD MEDALISTS ===") # Look for any mention of this year's results year_str = str(target_year) year_sentences = [] for sentence in sentences: if year_str in sentence and len(sentence.strip()) > 20: year_sentences.append(sentence.strip()) print(f"Found {len(year_sentences)} sentences mentioning {target_year}:") for i, sentence in enumerate(year_sentences[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. {sentence[:150]}...") # Look for medal/results tables that might contain this year's data print(f"\nSearching for medal results tables containing {target_year}...") medal_results = [] gold_medalists = [] for i, table in enumerate(all_tables): table_text = table.get_text() if year_str in table_text: # Check if this table contains medal/winner information medal_indicators = ['gold', 'silver', 'bronze', 'medal', 'winner', 'champion', 'first', '1st'] medal_score = 0 for indicator in medal_indicators: if indicator in table_text.lower(): medal_score += 1 if medal_score >= 1: print(f"\nTable {i+1} - Contains {target_year} and medal information (score: {medal_score}):") headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts}") # Extract rows containing the target year rows = table.find_all('tr') for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): row_text = row.get_text() if year_str in row_text: cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] print(f" {target_year} Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Look for country information in this row countries_found = [] country_patterns = ['Italy', 'Germany', 'Austria', 'Switzerland', 'France', 'Sweden', 'Czech', 'Poland', 'United States', 'Canada', 'Japan', 'Russia'] for country in country_patterns: if country.lower() in row_text.lower(): countries_found.append(country) # Look for names (potential gold medalists) # Names are typically capitalized words potential_names = re.findall(r'[A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+', row_text) if countries_found or potential_names: print(f" Countries identified: {countries_found}") print(f" Potential names: {potential_names}") medal_entry = { 'year': target_year, 'table_index': i, 'row_data': cell_texts, 'countries': countries_found, 'potential_names': potential_names, 'raw_text': row_text } medal_results.append(medal_entry) # If this looks like a gold medal result, add to gold medalists if 'gold' in row_text.lower() or 'first' in row_text.lower() or '1st' in row_text.lower(): gold_medalists.append(medal_entry) # Extract unique countries that won gold medals gold_medal_countries = [] for result in gold_medalists: gold_medal_countries.extend(result['countries']) gold_medal_countries = sorted(set(gold_medal_countries)) # Save comprehensive results final_results = { 'target_championship': { 'year': target_year, 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo, Italy', 'notable': 'Championship without Finland or Norway participants' }, 'source_analysis': { 'source_file': fis_nordic_file, 'total_tables_analyzed': len(all_tables), 'cortina_mentions': cortina_mentions, 'championship_candidates': len(championship_data) }, 'medal_results_found': medal_results, 'gold_medalists': gold_medalists, 'countries_with_gold_medals': gold_medal_countries, 'all_countries_mentioned': sorted(set([country for result in medal_results for country in result['countries']])) } with open('workspace/fis_cortina_championship_final_results.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2) print(f"\n=== FINAL RESULTS ===") print(f"Target Championship: {target_year} FIS Nordic World Ski Championships") print(f"Location: Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy") print(f"Key Finding: This championship did NOT include participants from Finland or Norway") print(f"\nGold Medal Results Found: {len(gold_medalists)}") for i, gold in enumerate(gold_medalists, 1): print(f" {i}. Countries: {gold['countries']} | Names: {gold['potential_names']}") if final_results['countries_with_gold_medals']: print(f"\nCountries that won GOLD medals at this championship:") for country in final_results['countries_with_gold_medals']: print(f" ‚òÖ {country}") if final_results['all_countries_mentioned']: print(f"\nAll countries mentioned in medal results:") for country in final_results['all_countries_mentioned']: print(f" - {country}") print(f"\nComplete results saved to: workspace/fis_cortina_championship_final_results.json") else: print(f"\nNo clear target championship identified without Finland/Norway participants") else: print("No FIS Nordic Championships file found for analysis") print(f"\n=== ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===")
Execution Output
Code Output: === FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS ANALYSIS (FINAL FIX) === Objective: Parse saved HTML files to find Cortina championships without Finland/Norway Then extract gold medalist list with countries Step 1: Inspecting workspace files... Found 5 files in workspace: - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html (319,150 bytes) - fis_cortina_research_summary.json (1,158 bytes) - www_fis-ski_com.html (185,391 bytes) - cortina_research_summary.json (1,014 bytes) - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Cortina_d_Ampezzo.html (376,006 bytes) HTML files available for analysis: 3 Found FIS Nordic Championships file: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html Found Cortina d'Ampezzo file: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Cortina_d_Ampezzo.html === ANALYZING FIS NORDIC CHAMPIONSHIPS FILE:
