developer
2025-08-12 03:35:45
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 2)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time import re # Create workspace directory if it doesn't exist if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS GOLD MEDALISTS RESEARCH (FIXED) ===") print("Target: Gold medalists from Cortina d'Ampezzo 1927 with birth countries") print("Focus: Complete list of individual winners from Sweden and Italy with birthplaces\n") # Search strategy: Start with official FIS sources and Wikipedia headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Primary sources to search for 1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships search_urls = [ "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927", "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships", "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cortina_d%27Ampezzo", "https://www.fis-ski.com", "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships" ] print("Step 1: Searching for official 1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships information...\n") successful_sources = [] failed_sources = [] for url in search_urls: print(f"Trying: {url}") try: response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=20) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úì Successfully accessed {url}") # Save the content for analysis filename = url.replace('https://', '').replace('http://', '').replace('/', '_').replace('.', '_').replace('%27', '_').replace('%20', '_') + '.html' filepath = f'workspace/{filename}' with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) # Quick content analysis - FIX: Initialize variables properly soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'No title found' # Initialize content_text here to avoid scope issues content_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Look for 1927 championship related content championship_indicators = ['1927', 'cortina', 'ampezzo', 'gold medal', 'champion', 'winner', 'sweden', 'italy', 'nordic', 'ski'] has_championship_info = any(indicator in content_text for indicator in championship_indicators) # Count specific 1927 mentions mentions_1927 = content_text.count('1927') mentions_cortina = content_text.count('cortina') mentions_gold = content_text.count('gold') successful_sources.append({ 'url': url, 'title': title_text, 'filename': filepath, 'has_championship_info': has_championship_info, 'content_length': len(response.text), 'mentions_1927': mentions_1927, 'mentions_cortina': mentions_cortina, 'mentions_gold': mentions_gold }) print(f" Title: {title_text}") print(f" Content length: {len(response.text)} characters") print(f" Contains 1927 championship info: {has_championship_info}") print(f" Mentions '1927': {mentions_1927} times") print(f" Mentions 'cortina': {mentions_cortina} times") print(f" Mentions 'gold': {mentions_gold} times") else: failed_sources.append({'url': url, 'status': response.status_code}) print(f"‚úó Failed to access {url} - Status: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: failed_sources.append({'url': url, 'error': str(e)}) print(f"‚úó Error accessing {url}: {str(e)}") print() # Empty line for readability time.sleep(2) # Be respectful to servers print(f"=== INITIAL SEARCH RESULTS ===") print(f"Successfully accessed: {len(successful_sources)} sources") print(f"Failed to access: {len(failed_sources)} sources\n") # Define relevance calculation function def calculate_relevance_score(source): score = 0 if source['has_championship_info']: score += 10 score += source['mentions_1927'] * 2 score += source['mentions_cortina'] * 3 score += source['mentions_gold'] * 1 return score # Analyze successful sources and prioritize them if successful_sources: print("--- Analyzing Successful Sources ---\n") # Sort by relevance (combination of championship info and 1927 mentions) successful_sources.sort(key=calculate_relevance_score, reverse=True) for i, source in enumerate(successful_sources, 1): relevance_score = calculate_relevance_score(source) print(f"{i}. {source['url']}") print(f" Title: {source['title']}") print(f" File saved: {source['filename']}") print(f" Relevance score: {relevance_score}") print(f" Has championship info: {source['has_championship_info']}") if relevance_score > 5: print(f" *** HIGH PRIORITY SOURCE ***") elif relevance_score > 0: print(f" *** MEDIUM PRIORITY SOURCE ***") print() # Now let's examine the content of the most promising sources priority_sources = [s for s in successful_sources if calculate_relevance_score(s) > 0] if priority_sources: print(f"=== DETAILED ANALYSIS OF PRIORITY SOURCES ===\n") for i, source in enumerate(priority_sources[:3], 1): # Analyze top 3 sources print(f"Analyzing Source {i}: {source['url']}") with open(source['filename'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Look for tables, lists, or sections that might contain medal information tables = soup.find_all('table') lists = soup.find_all(['ul', 'ol']) print(f" Found {len(tables)} tables and {len(lists)} lists") # Look for gold medal winners specifically text_content = soup.get_text() # Search for Swedish and Italian names/mentions swedish_indicators = ['sweden', 'swedish', 'sverige'] italian_indicators = ['italy', 'italian', 'italia'] swedish_mentions = sum(text_content.lower().count(indicator) for indicator in swedish_indicators) italian_mentions = sum(text_content.lower().count(indicator) for indicator in italian_indicators) print(f" Swedish mentions: {swedish_mentions}") print(f" Italian mentions: {italian_mentions}") # Look for potential winner names (capitalized words that could be names) # Focus on context around "gold" or "winner" or "champion" gold_contexts = [] lines = text_content.split('\n') for line in lines: if 'gold' in line.lower() and ('1927' in line or any(indicator in line.lower() for indicator in swedish_indicators + italian_indicators)): gold_contexts.append(line.strip()) if gold_contexts: print(f" Lines mentioning gold medals with 1927/Sweden/Italy context:") for context in gold_contexts[:5]: # Show first 5 relevant lines print(f" - {context}") # Save detailed analysis for this source source_analysis = { 'url': source['url'], 'relevance_score': calculate_relevance_score(source), 'tables_found': len(tables), 'lists_found': len(lists), 'swedish_mentions': swedish_mentions, 'italian_mentions': italian_mentions, 'gold_medal_contexts': gold_contexts, 'content_sample': text_content[:2000] # First 2000 characters } analysis_filename = f'workspace/fis_1927_analysis_{i}.json' with open(analysis_filename, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(source_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f" Analysis saved to: {analysis_filename}") print() else: print("No sources successfully accessed. Will need to try alternative search methods.") # Save overall research summary research_summary = { 'research_target': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships gold medalists', 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo', 'focus': 'Birth countries of gold medalists, especially from Sweden and Italy', 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'successful_sources': len(successful_sources), 'failed_sources': len(failed_sources), 'priority_sources': len([s for s in successful_sources if calculate_relevance_score(s) > 0]), 'sources_data': successful_sources, 'failed_attempts': failed_sources } with open('workspace/fis_1927_research_summary.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(research_summary, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"=== RESEARCH PHASE 1 COMPLETE ===") print(f"Research summary saved to: workspace/fis_1927_research_summary.json") print(f"Next steps: Parse priority sources for detailed gold medalist information") print(f"Focus areas: Extract names, events, and birth countries of 1927 gold medalists")
Execution Output
Code Output: === 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS GOLD MEDALISTS RESEARCH (FIXED) === Target: Gold medalists from Cortina d'Ampezzo 1927 with birth countries Focus: Complete list of individual winners from Sweden and Italy with birthplaces Step 1: Searching for official 1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships information... Trying: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927 Response status: 200 ‚úì Successfully accessed https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927 ‚úó Error accessing https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927: name 'content_text' is not defined Trying: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships Response status: 200 ‚úì Successfully accessed https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships ‚úó Error accessing https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships: name 'content_text' is not defined Trying: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cortina_d%27Ampezzo Response status: 200 ‚úì Successfully accessed https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cortina_d%27Ampezzo ‚úó Error accessing https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cortina_d%27Ampezzo: name 'content_text' is not defined Trying: https://www.fis-ski.com Response status: 200 ‚úì Successfully accessed https://www.fis-ski.com ‚úó Error accessing https://www.fis-ski.com: name 'content_text' is not defined Trying: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships Response status: 200 ‚úì Successfully accessed https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships ‚úó Error accessing https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships: name 'content_text' is not defined === INITIAL SEARCH RESULTS === Successfully accessed: 0 sources Failed to access: 5 sources No sources successfully accessed. tester
2025-08-12 03:35:45
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code successfully connected to all 5 target URLs (all returned status 200) but crashed due to the same variable scope error from the previous iteration. The error 'name 'content_text' is not defined' persists because the fix was incomplete - 'content_text' is still being accessed in the except block where it's not defined. Despite the comment 'FIX: Initialize variables properly', the actual fix wasn't implemented correctly. The code saves HTML files to workspace but processes 0 successful sources due to the crash. **PLAN** alignment: 5% - HTTP connections work but no gold medalist data extracted. Recommended fix: Remove or properly handle the 'content_text' reference in the except block, or initialize 'content_text' before the try block to ensure it's always available in the exception handler scope.
Python Code python
import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json import time import re # Create workspace directory if it doesn't exist if not os.path.exists('workspace'): os.makedirs('workspace') print("=== 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS GOLD MEDALISTS RESEARCH (FIXED) ===") print("Target: Gold medalists from Cortina d'Ampezzo 1927 with birth countries") print("Focus: Complete list of individual winners from Sweden and Italy with birthplaces\n") # Search strategy: Start with official FIS sources and Wikipedia headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Primary sources to search for 1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships search_urls = [ "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927", "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships", "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cortina_d%27Ampezzo", "https://www.fis-ski.com", "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships" ] print("Step 1: Searching for official 1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships information...\n") successful_sources = [] failed_sources = [] for url in search_urls: print(f"Trying: {url}") try: response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=20) print(f"Response status: {response.status_code}") if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úì Successfully accessed {url}") # Save the content for analysis filename = url.replace('https://', '').replace('http://', '').replace('/', '_').replace('.', '_').replace('%27', '_').replace('%20', '_') + '.html' filepath = f'workspace/{filename}' with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) # Quick content analysis - FIX: Initialize variables properly soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'No title found' # Initialize content_text here to avoid scope issues content_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Look for 1927 championship related content championship_indicators = ['1927', 'cortina', 'ampezzo', 'gold medal', 'champion', 'winner', 'sweden', 'italy', 'nordic', 'ski'] has_championship_info = any(indicator in content_text for indicator in championship_indicators) # Count specific 1927 mentions mentions_1927 = content_text.count('1927') mentions_cortina = content_text.count('cortina') mentions_gold = content_text.count('gold') successful_sources.append({ 'url': url, 'title': title_text, 'filename': filepath, 'has_championship_info': has_championship_info, 'content_length': len(response.text), 'mentions_1927': mentions_1927, 'mentions_cortina': mentions_cortina, 'mentions_gold': mentions_gold }) print(f" Title: {title_text}") print(f" Content length: {len(response.text)} characters") print(f" Contains 1927 championship info: {has_championship_info}") print(f" Mentions '1927': {mentions_1927} times") print(f" Mentions 'cortina': {mentions_cortina} times") print(f" Mentions 'gold': {mentions_gold} times") else: failed_sources.append({'url': url, 'status': response.status_code}) print(f"‚úó Failed to access {url} - Status: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: failed_sources.append({'url': url, 'error': str(e)}) print(f"‚úó Error accessing {url}: {str(e)}") print() # Empty line for readability time.sleep(2) # Be respectful to servers print(f"=== INITIAL SEARCH RESULTS ===") print(f"Successfully accessed: {len(successful_sources)} sources") print(f"Failed to access: {len(failed_sources)} sources\n") # Define relevance calculation function def calculate_relevance_score(source): score = 0 if source['has_championship_info']: score += 10 score += source['mentions_1927'] * 2 score += source['mentions_cortina'] * 3 score += source['mentions_gold'] * 1 return score # Analyze successful sources and prioritize them if successful_sources: print("--- Analyzing Successful Sources ---\n") # Sort by relevance (combination of championship info and 1927 mentions) successful_sources.sort(key=calculate_relevance_score, reverse=True) for i, source in enumerate(successful_sources, 1): relevance_score = calculate_relevance_score(source) print(f"{i}. {source['url']}") print(f" Title: {source['title']}") print(f" File saved: {source['filename']}") print(f" Relevance score: {relevance_score}") print(f" Has championship info: {source['has_championship_info']}") if relevance_score > 5: print(f" *** HIGH PRIORITY SOURCE ***") elif relevance_score > 0: print(f" *** MEDIUM PRIORITY SOURCE ***") print() # Now let's examine the content of the most promising sources priority_sources = [s for s in successful_sources if calculate_relevance_score(s) > 0] if priority_sources: print(f"=== DETAILED ANALYSIS OF PRIORITY SOURCES ===\n") for i, source in enumerate(priority_sources[:3], 1): # Analyze top 3 sources print(f"Analyzing Source {i}: {source['url']}") with open(source['filename'], 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Look for tables, lists, or sections that might contain medal information tables = soup.find_all('table') lists = soup.find_all(['ul', 'ol']) print(f" Found {len(tables)} tables and {len(lists)} lists") # Look for gold medal winners specifically text_content = soup.get_text() # Search for Swedish and Italian names/mentions swedish_indicators = ['sweden', 'swedish', 'sverige'] italian_indicators = ['italy', 'italian', 'italia'] swedish_mentions = sum(text_content.lower().count(indicator) for indicator in swedish_indicators) italian_mentions = sum(text_content.lower().count(indicator) for indicator in italian_indicators) print(f" Swedish mentions: {swedish_mentions}") print(f" Italian mentions: {italian_mentions}") # Look for potential winner names (capitalized words that could be names) # Focus on context around "gold" or "winner" or "champion" gold_contexts = [] lines = text_content.split('\n') for line in lines: if 'gold' in line.lower() and ('1927' in line or any(indicator in line.lower() for indicator in swedish_indicators + italian_indicators)): gold_contexts.append(line.strip()) if gold_contexts: print(f" Lines mentioning gold medals with 1927/Sweden/Italy context:") for context in gold_contexts[:5]: # Show first 5 relevant lines print(f" - {context}") # Save detailed analysis for this source source_analysis = { 'url': source['url'], 'relevance_score': calculate_relevance_score(source), 'tables_found': len(tables), 'lists_found': len(lists), 'swedish_mentions': swedish_mentions, 'italian_mentions': italian_mentions, 'gold_medal_contexts': gold_contexts, 'content_sample': text_content[:2000] # First 2000 characters } analysis_filename = f'workspace/fis_1927_analysis_{i}.json' with open(analysis_filename, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(source_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f" Analysis saved to: {analysis_filename}") print() else: print("No sources successfully accessed. Will need to try alternative search methods.") # Save overall research summary research_summary = { 'research_target': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships gold medalists', 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo', 'focus': 'Birth countries of gold medalists, especially from Sweden and Italy', 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'successful_sources': len(successful_sources), 'failed_sources': len(failed_sources), 'priority_sources': len([s for s in successful_sources if calculate_relevance_score(s) > 0]), 'sources_data': successful_sources, 'failed_attempts': failed_sources } with open('workspace/fis_1927_research_summary.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(research_summary, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"=== RESEARCH PHASE 1 COMPLETE ===") print(f"Research summary saved to: workspace/fis_1927_research_summary.json") print(f"Next steps: Parse priority sources for detailed gold medalist information") print(f"Focus areas: Extract names, events, and birth countries of 1927 gold medalists")
Execution Output
Code Output: === 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS GOLD MEDALISTS RESEARCH (FIXED) === Target: Gold medalists from Cortina d'Ampezzo 1927 with birth countries Focus: Complete list of individual winners from Sweden and Italy with birthplaces Step 1: Searching for official 1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships information... Trying: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927 Response status: 200 ‚úì Successfully accessed https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927 ‚úó Error accessing https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927: name 'content_text' is not defined Trying: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships Response status: 200 ‚úì Successfully accessed https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships ‚úó Error accessing https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships: name 'content_text' is not defined Trying: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cortina_d%27Ampezzo Response status: 200 ‚úì Successfully accessed https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cortina_d%27Ampezzo ‚úó Error accessing https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cortina_d%27Ampezzo: name 'content_text' is not defined Trying: https://www.fis-ski.com Response status: 200 ‚úì Successfully accessed https://www.fis-ski.com ‚úó Error accessing https://www.fis-ski.com: name 'content_text' is not defined Trying: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships Response status: 200 ‚úì Successfully accessed https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships ‚úó Error accessing https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships: name 'content_text' is not defined === INITIAL SEARCH RESULTS === Successfully accessed: 0 sources Failed to access: 5 sources No sources successfully accessed. Will need to try alternative search methods. === RESEARCH PHASE 1 COMPLETE === Research summary saved to: workspace_webshaper_57/fis_1927_research_summary.json Next steps: Parse priority sources for detailed gold medalist information Focus areas: Extract names, events, and birth countries of 1927 gold medalists

2025-08-12 03:36:34
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 3)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print("=== 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: PARSING DOWNLOADED FILES ===") print("Target: Extract gold medalists from Cortina d'Ampezzo 1927 with birth countries") print("Focus: Complete list of individual winners from Sweden and Italy with birthplaces\n") # First, let's see what files we have in workspace workspace_path = 'workspace' if not os.path.exists(workspace_path): os.makedirs(workspace_path) print("Files available in workspace:") workspace_files = [] if os.path.exists(workspace_path): for file in os.listdir(workspace_path): print(f" - {file}") workspace_files.append(file) else: print(" No workspace directory found") # Look for HTML files that might contain the 1927 championship data html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"\nFound {len(html_files)} HTML files to analyze:") for html_file in html_files: print(f" - {html_file}") # Since the previous attempts failed due to scope issues, let's directly parse the HTML files # that were successfully downloaded (we know they got status 200) expected_files = [ 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Cortina_d_Ampezzo.html', 'www_fis-ski_com.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html' ] print("\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR 1927 GOLD MEDALISTS ===") successful_analyses = [] for expected_file in expected_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_path, expected_file) if os.path.exists(file_path): print(f"\nAnalyzing: {expected_file}") try: with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f" File size: {len(html_content)} characters") # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'No title found' print(f" Page title: {title_text}") # Get text content for analysis text_content = soup.get_text() text_lower = text_content.lower() # Look for 1927 championship indicators mentions_1927 = text_lower.count('1927') mentions_cortina = text_lower.count('cortina') mentions_gold = text_lower.count('gold') mentions_medal = text_lower.count('medal') mentions_winner = text_lower.count('winner') mentions_champion = text_lower.count('champion') print(f" Mentions of '1927': {mentions_1927}") print(f" Mentions of 'cortina': {mentions_cortina}") print(f" Mentions of 'gold': {mentions_gold}") print(f" Mentions of 'medal': {mentions_medal}") print(f" Mentions of 'winner': {mentions_winner}") print(f" Mentions of 'champion': {mentions_champion}") # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = mentions_1927 * 3 + mentions_cortina * 5 + mentions_gold * 2 + mentions_medal * 1 print(f" Relevance score: {relevance_score}") # Look for tables that might contain results tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f" Tables found: {len(tables)}") # Look for specific patterns related to gold medalists gold_contexts = [] lines = text_content.split('\n') for line in lines: line_lower = line.lower().strip() if ('gold' in line_lower and '1927' in line_lower) or \ ('gold' in line_lower and 'cortina' in line_lower) or \ ('winner' in line_lower and '1927' in line_lower): if len(line.strip()) > 5: # Avoid empty or very short lines gold_contexts.append(line.strip()) if gold_contexts: print(f" Found {len(gold_contexts)} lines with gold/winner + 1927/cortina context:") for i, context in enumerate(gold_contexts[:5], 1): # Show first 5 print(f" {i}. {context[:100]}..." if len(context) > 100 else f" {i}. {context}") # Store analysis results analysis_result = { 'filename': expected_file, 'title': title_text, 'file_size': len(html_content), 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'mentions': { '1927': mentions_1927, 'cortina': mentions_cortina, 'gold': mentions_gold, 'medal': mentions_medal, 'winner': mentions_winner, 'champion': mentions_champion }, 'tables_count': len(tables), 'gold_contexts': gold_contexts[:10], # Store first 10 relevant contexts 'has_relevant_content': relevance_score > 5 } successful_analyses.append(analysis_result) if relevance_score > 5: print(f" *** HIGH PRIORITY FILE - Contains relevant 1927 championship content ***") except Exception as e: print(f" Error analyzing {expected_file}: {str(e)}") else: print(f"\nFile not found: {expected_file}") print(f"\n=== ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===") print(f"Successfully analyzed: {len(successful_analyses)} files") # Sort by relevance score successful_analyses.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) print("\nFiles ranked by relevance:") for i, analysis in enumerate(successful_analyses, 1): print(f"{i}. {analysis['filename']} (Score: {analysis['relevance_score']})") print(f" Title: {analysis['title'][:80]}..." if len(analysis['title']) > 80 else f" Title: {analysis['title']}") if analysis['has_relevant_content']: print(f" *** PRIORITY FILE FOR DETAILED PARSING ***") # Save analysis summary analysis_summary = { 'analysis_timestamp': '2024-01-01', # Placeholder 'target': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships gold medalists', 'files_analyzed': len(successful_analyses), 'priority_files': [a['filename'] for a in successful_analyses if a['has_relevant_content']], 'detailed_analyses': successful_analyses } with open('workspace/fis_1927_file_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_summary, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nAnalysis summary saved to: workspace/fis_1927_file_analysis.json") print(f"Priority files identified: {len([a for a in successful_analyses if a['has_relevant_content']])}") print("\nNext step: Parse the highest priority files for detailed gold medalist information")
Execution Output

Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print("=== 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: PARSING DOWNLOADED FILES ===") print("Target: Extract gold medalists from Cortina d'Ampezzo 1927 with birth countries") print("Focus: Complete list of individual winners from Sweden and Italy with birthplaces\n") # First, let's see what files we have in workspace workspace_path = 'workspace' if not os.path.exists(workspace_path): os.makedirs(workspace_path) print("Files available in workspace:") workspace_files = [] if os.path.exists(workspace_path): for file in os.listdir(workspace_path): print(f" - {file}") workspace_files.append(file) else: print(" No workspace directory found") # Look for HTML files that might contain the 1927 championship data html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f"\nFound {len(html_files)} HTML files to analyze:") for html_file in html_files: print(f" - {html_file}") # Since the previous attempts failed due to scope issues, let's directly parse the HTML files # that were successfully downloaded (we know they got status 200) expected_files = [ 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Cortina_d_Ampezzo.html', 'www_fis-ski_com.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html' ] print("\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES FOR 1927 GOLD MEDALISTS ===") successful_analyses = [] for expected_file in expected_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_path, expected_file) if os.path.exists(file_path): print(f"\nAnalyzing: {expected_file}") try: with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f" File size: {len(html_content)} characters") # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'No title found' print(f" Page title: {title_text}") # Get text content for analysis text_content = soup.get_text() text_lower = text_content.lower() # Look for 1927 championship indicators mentions_1927 = text_lower.count('1927') mentions_cortina = text_lower.count('cortina') mentions_gold = text_lower.count('gold') mentions_medal = text_lower.count('medal') mentions_winner = text_lower.count('winner') mentions_champion = text_lower.count('champion') print(f" Mentions of '1927': {mentions_1927}") print(f" Mentions of 'cortina': {mentions_cortina}") print(f" Mentions of 'gold': {mentions_gold}") print(f" Mentions of 'medal': {mentions_medal}") print(f" Mentions of 'winner': {mentions_winner}") print(f" Mentions of 'champion': {mentions_champion}") # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = mentions_1927 * 3 + mentions_cortina * 5 + mentions_gold * 2 + mentions_medal * 1 print(f" Relevance score: {relevance_score}") # Look for tables that might contain results tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f" Tables found: {len(tables)}") # Look for specific patterns related to gold medalists gold_contexts = [] lines = text_content.split('\n') for line in lines: line_lower = line.lower().strip() if ('gold' in line_lower and '1927' in line_lower) or \ ('gold' in line_lower and 'cortina' in line_lower) or \ ('winner' in line_lower and '1927' in line_lower): if len(line.strip()) > 5: # Avoid empty or very short lines gold_contexts.append(line.strip()) if gold_contexts: print(f" Found {len(gold_contexts)} lines with gold/winner + 1927/cortina context:") for i, context in enumerate(gold_contexts[:5], 1): # Show first 5 print(f" {i}. {context[:100]}..." if len(context) > 100 else f" {i}. {context}") # Store analysis results analysis_result = { 'filename': expected_file, 'title': title_text, 'file_size': len(html_content), 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'mentions': { '1927': mentions_1927, 'cortina': mentions_cortina, 'gold': mentions_gold, 'medal': mentions_medal, 'winner': mentions_winner, 'champion': mentions_champion }, 'tables_count': len(tables), 'gold_contexts': gold_contexts[:10], # Store first 10 relevant contexts 'has_relevant_content': relevance_score > 5 } successful_analyses.append(analysis_result) if relevance_score > 5: print(f" *** HIGH PRIORITY FILE - Contains relevant 1927 championship content ***") except Exception as e: print(f" Error analyzing {expected_file}: {str(e)}") else: print(f"\nFile not found: {expected_file}") print(f"\n=== ANALYSIS SUMMARY ===") print(f"Successfully analyzed: {len(successful_analyses)} files") # Sort by relevance score successful_analyses.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) print("\nFiles ranked by relevance:") for i, analysis in enumerate(successful_analyses, 1): print(f"{i}. {analysis['filename']} (Score: {analysis['relevance_score']})") print(f" Title: {analysis['title'][:80]}..." if len(analysis['title']) > 80 else f" Title: {analysis['title']}") if analysis['has_relevant_content']: print(f" *** PRIORITY FILE FOR DETAILED PARSING ***") # Save analysis summary analysis_summary = { 'analysis_timestamp': '2024-01-01', # Placeholder 'target': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships gold medalists', 'files_analyzed': len(successful_analyses), 'priority_files': [a['filename'] for a in successful_analyses if a['has_relevant_content']], 'detailed_analyses': successful_analyses } with open('workspace/fis_1927_file_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_summary, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nAnalysis summary saved to: workspace/fis_1927_file_analysis.json") print(f"Priority files identified: {len([a for a in successful_analyses if a['has_relevant_content']])}") print("\nNext step: Parse the highest priority files for detailed gold medalist information")

Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 4)

Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print("=== 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: DETAILED GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION ===") print("Target: Extract specific gold medalists with names, events, and birth countries") print("Focus: Individual winners from Sweden and Italy with biographical information\n") # First, let's inspect the analysis file to understand the structure analysis_file = 'workspace/fis_1927_file_analysis.json' if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print("Inspecting analysis file structure:") with open(analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: analysis_data = json.load(f) print(f"Top-level keys: {list(analysis_data.keys())}") if 'priority_files' in analysis_data: priority_files = analysis_data['priority_files'] print(f"Priority files for parsing: {priority_files}") else: print("No priority files found in analysis") else: print("Analysis file not found, will analyze all available HTML files") priority_files = [ 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html' ] print(f"\n=== PARSING TOP PRIORITY FILES FOR GOLD MEDALISTS ===") # Focus on the most relevant files for 1927 championship data target_files = [ 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html' ] all_gold_medalists = [] for target_file in target_files: file_path = f'workspace/{target_file}' if os.path.exists(file_path): print(f"\nParsing: {target_file}") with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title for context title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'Unknown title' print(f"Page title: {title_text}") # Look for tables that might contain results tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Found {len(tables)} tables to analyze") # Analyze each table for medal results for table_idx, table in enumerate(tables, 1): print(f"\n Analyzing Table {table_idx}:") # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts[:6]}") # Get all rows rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Rows: {len(rows)}") # Check if this table contains medal/result information table_text = table.get_text().lower() has_medal_info = any(keyword in table_text for keyword in ['gold', 'medal', 'winner', '1st', 'first']) has_country_info = any(keyword in table_text for keyword in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']) print(f" Contains medal info: {has_medal_info}") print(f" Contains Sweden/Italy info: {has_country_info}") if has_medal_info or has_country_info: print(f" *** ANALYZING TABLE {table_idx} IN DETAIL ***") # Extract data from each row for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] if len(cell_texts) > 1: # Skip empty rows row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts).lower() # Look for gold medal indicators is_gold_row = any(indicator in row_text for indicator in ['gold', '1st', 'first', 'winner']) has_sweden_italy = any(country in row_text for country in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita', 'swedish', 'italian']) if is_gold_row or has_sweden_italy: print(f" Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Try to extract structured information potential_medalist = { 'source_file': target_file, 'table_index': table_idx, 'row_index': row_idx, 'raw_data': cell_texts, 'is_gold_medal': is_gold_row, 'involves_sweden_italy': has_sweden_italy } # Try to identify name, event, and country name = None event = None country = None for cell in cell_texts: # Look for names (capitalized words) name_pattern = re.findall(r'[A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+', cell) if name_pattern and not name: name = name_pattern[0] # Look for countries if any(c in cell.lower() for c in ['sweden', 'swe', 'swedish']): country = 'Sweden' elif any(c in cell.lower() for c in ['italy', 'ita', 'italian']): country = 'Italy' # Look for ski events if any(event_word in cell.lower() for event_word in ['ski', 'jump', 'cross', 'nordic', 'combined']): if not event: event = cell potential_medalist.update({ 'extracted_name': name, 'extracted_event': event, 'extracted_country': country }) all_gold_medalists.append(potential_medalist) if is_gold_row and (name or country): print(f" *** POTENTIAL GOLD MEDALIST FOUND ***") print(f" Name: {name}") print(f" Event: {event}") print(f" Country: {country}") # Also look for text sections that might mention gold medalists print(f"\n Searching text content for additional gold medalist mentions:") text_content = soup.get_text() # Look for patterns like "Gold: Name (Country)" or similar gold_patterns = [ r'Gold[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)', r'1st[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)', r'Winner[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)' ] for pattern in gold_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content) for match in matches: name, country_info = match print(f" Pattern match - Name: {name}, Country: {country_info}") # Check if this involves Sweden or Italy if any(c in country_info.lower() for c in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']): text_medalist = { 'source_file': target_file, 'extraction_method': 'text_pattern', 'extracted_name': name, 'extracted_country': country_info, 'raw_match': f"{name} ({country_info})" } all_gold_medalists.append(text_medalist) print(f" *** SWEDEN/ITALY GOLD MEDALIST FROM TEXT: {name} ({country_info}) ***") else: print(f"File not found: {target_file}") print(f"\n=== GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION SUMMARY ===") print(f"Total potential medalists extracted: {len(all_gold_medalists)}") # Filter and organize results gold_medalists_sweden_italy = [] for medalist in all_gold_medalists: country = medalist.get('extracted_country', '') if country and any(c in country.lower() for c in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']): gold_medalists_sweden_italy.append(medalist) print(f"Gold medalists from Sweden/Italy: {len(gold_medalists_sweden_italy)}") if gold_medalists_sweden_italy: print("\nDetailed results:") for i, medalist in enumerate(gold_medalists_sweden_italy, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {medalist.get('extracted_name', 'Name not extracted')}") print(f" Country: {medalist.get('extracted_country', 'Country not extracted')}") print(f" Event: {medalist.get('extracted_event', 'Event not extracted')}") print(f" Source: {medalist.get('source_file', 'Unknown source')}") print(f" Raw data: {medalist.get('raw_data', medalist.get('raw_match', 'No raw data'))}") else: print("\nNo gold medalists from Sweden or Italy clearly identified in the parsed content.") print("This may indicate:") print("1. The medal results are in a different format than expected") print("2. The information requires more specific parsing") print("3. The data might be in different sections of the pages") # Save extraction results extraction_results = { 'extraction_timestamp': '2024-01-01', 'target_championship': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships', 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo', 'focus_countries': ['Sweden', 'Italy'], 'total_potential_medalists': len(all_gold_medalists), 'sweden_italy_medalists': len(gold_medalists_sweden_italy), 'detailed_results': all_gold_medalists, 'sweden_italy_only': gold_medalists_sweden_italy } with open('workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_extraction.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(extraction_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nExtraction results saved to: workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_extraction.json") print(f"Ready for next phase: Detailed biographical research on identified medalists")
Execution Output
Code Output: === 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: DETAILED GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION === Target: Extract specific gold medalists with names, events, and birth countries Focus: Individual winners from Sweden and Italy with biographical information Inspecting analysis file structure: Top-level keys: ['analysis_timestamp', 'target', 'files_analyzed', 'priority_files', 'detailed_analyses'] Priority files for parsing: ['en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Cortina_d_Ampezzo.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html'] === PARSING TOP PRIORITY FILES FOR GOLD MEDALISTS === Parsing: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html Page title: FIS Nordic World Ski Championships 1927 - Wikipedia Found 7 tables to analyze Analyzing Table 1: Headers: ['Host city', 'Country', 'Events', 'Opening', 'Closing'] Rows: 6 Execution error: NameError: name 'table_text' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/xushiyue.6/codes/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ‰ΩøÁî®Áã¨Á´ãÁöÑ locals ~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 77, in <module> File "<string>", line 77, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'table_text' is not defined
tester
2025-08-12 03:37:34
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code crashed with a NameError: name 'table_text' is not defined on line 77. The error occurs in the list comprehension where 'table_text' is referenced but was never defined in the current scope. The code successfully started parsing the first HTML file (FIS Nordic World Ski Championships 1927) and found 7 tables to analyze, but failed when trying to check if tables contain medal information. **PLAN** alignment: 15% - file loading and initial parsing worked, but crashed before extracting any gold medalist data. Recommended fix: Define 'table_text = table.get_text().lower()' before the line that uses it in the medal info detection logic, or replace the undefined variable reference with the correct variable name.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print("=== 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: DETAILED GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION ===") print("Target: Extract specific gold medalists with names, events, and birth countries") print("Focus: Individual winners from Sweden and Italy with biographical information\n") # First, let's inspect the analysis file to understand the structure analysis_file = 'workspace/fis_1927_file_analysis.json' if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print("Inspecting analysis file structure:") with open(analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: analysis_data = json.load(f) print(f"Top-level keys: {list(analysis_data.keys())}") if 'priority_files' in analysis_data: priority_files = analysis_data['priority_files'] print(f"Priority files for parsing: {priority_files}") else: print("No priority files found in analysis") else: print("Analysis file not found, will analyze all available HTML files") priority_files = [ 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html' ] print(f"\n=== PARSING TOP PRIORITY FILES FOR GOLD MEDALISTS ===") # Focus on the most relevant files for 1927 championship data target_files = [ 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html' ] all_gold_medalists = [] for target_file in target_files: file_path = f'workspace/{target_file}' if os.path.exists(file_path): print(f"\nParsing: {target_file}") with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title for context title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'Unknown title' print(f"Page title: {title_text}") # Look for tables that might contain results tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Found {len(tables)} tables to analyze") # Analyze each table for medal results for table_idx, table in enumerate(tables, 1): print(f"\n Analyzing Table {table_idx}:") # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts[:6]}") # Get all rows rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Rows: {len(rows)}") # Check if this table contains medal/result information table_text = table.get_text().lower() has_medal_info = any(keyword in table_text for keyword in ['gold', 'medal', 'winner', '1st', 'first']) has_country_info = any(keyword in table_text for keyword in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']) print(f" Contains medal info: {has_medal_info}") print(f" Contains Sweden/Italy info: {has_country_info}") if has_medal_info or has_country_info: print(f" *** ANALYZING TABLE {table_idx} IN DETAIL ***") # Extract data from each row for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] if len(cell_texts) > 1: # Skip empty rows row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts).lower() # Look for gold medal indicators is_gold_row = any(indicator in row_text for indicator in ['gold', '1st', 'first', 'winner']) has_sweden_italy = any(country in row_text for country in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita', 'swedish', 'italian']) if is_gold_row or has_sweden_italy: print(f" Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Try to extract structured information potential_medalist = { 'source_file': target_file, 'table_index': table_idx, 'row_index': row_idx, 'raw_data': cell_texts, 'is_gold_medal': is_gold_row, 'involves_sweden_italy': has_sweden_italy } # Try to identify name, event, and country name = None event = None country = None for cell in cell_texts: # Look for names (capitalized words) name_pattern = re.findall(r'[A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+', cell) if name_pattern and not name: name = name_pattern[0] # Look for countries if any(c in cell.lower() for c in ['sweden', 'swe', 'swedish']): country = 'Sweden' elif any(c in cell.lower() for c in ['italy', 'ita', 'italian']): country = 'Italy' # Look for ski events if any(event_word in cell.lower() for event_word in ['ski', 'jump', 'cross', 'nordic', 'combined']): if not event: event = cell potential_medalist.update({ 'extracted_name': name, 'extracted_event': event, 'extracted_country': country }) all_gold_medalists.append(potential_medalist) if is_gold_row and (name or country): print(f" *** POTENTIAL GOLD MEDALIST FOUND ***") print(f" Name: {name}") print(f" Event: {event}") print(f" Country: {country}") # Also look for text sections that might mention gold medalists print(f"\n Searching text content for additional gold medalist mentions:") text_content = soup.get_text() # Look for patterns like "Gold: Name (Country)" or similar gold_patterns = [ r'Gold[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)', r'1st[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)', r'Winner[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)' ] for pattern in gold_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content) for match in matches: name, country_info = match print(f" Pattern match - Name: {name}, Country: {country_info}") # Check if this involves Sweden or Italy if any(c in country_info.lower() for c in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']): text_medalist = { 'source_file': target_file, 'extraction_method': 'text_pattern', 'extracted_name': name, 'extracted_country': country_info, 'raw_match': f"{name} ({country_info})" } all_gold_medalists.append(text_medalist) print(f" *** SWEDEN/ITALY GOLD MEDALIST FROM TEXT: {name} ({country_info}) ***") else: print(f"File not found: {target_file}") print(f"\n=== GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION SUMMARY ===") print(f"Total potential medalists extracted: {len(all_gold_medalists)}") # Filter and organize results gold_medalists_sweden_italy = [] for medalist in all_gold_medalists: country = medalist.get('extracted_country', '') if country and any(c in country.lower() for c in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']): gold_medalists_sweden_italy.append(medalist) print(f"Gold medalists from Sweden/Italy: {len(gold_medalists_sweden_italy)}") if gold_medalists_sweden_italy: print("\nDetailed results:") for i, medalist in enumerate(gold_medalists_sweden_italy, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {medalist.get('extracted_name', 'Name not extracted')}") print(f" Country: {medalist.get('extracted_country', 'Country not extracted')}") print(f" Event: {medalist.get('extracted_event', 'Event not extracted')}") print(f" Source: {medalist.get('source_file', 'Unknown source')}") print(f" Raw data: {medalist.get('raw_data', medalist.get('raw_match', 'No raw data'))}") else: print("\nNo gold medalists from Sweden or Italy clearly identified in the parsed content.") print("This may indicate:") print("1. The medal results are in a different format than expected") print("2. The information requires more specific parsing") print("3. The data might be in different sections of the pages") # Save extraction results extraction_results = { 'extraction_timestamp': '2024-01-01', 'target_championship': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships', 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo', 'focus_countries': ['Sweden', 'Italy'], 'total_potential_medalists': len(all_gold_medalists), 'sweden_italy_medalists': len(gold_medalists_sweden_italy), 'detailed_results': all_gold_medalists, 'sweden_italy_only': gold_medalists_sweden_italy } with open('workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_extraction.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(extraction_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nExtraction results saved to: workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_extraction.json") print(f"Ready for next phase: Detailed biographical research on identified medalists")
Execution Output
Code Output: === 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: DETAILED GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION === Target: Extract specific gold medalists with names, events, and birth countries Focus: Individual winners from Sweden and Italy with biographical information Inspecting analysis file structure: Top-level keys: ['analysis_timestamp', 'target', 'files_analyzed', 'priority_files', 'detailed_analyses'] Priority files for parsing: ['en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Cortina_d_Ampezzo.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html'] === PARSING TOP PRIORITY FILES FOR GOLD MEDALISTS === Parsing: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html Page title: FIS Nordic World Ski Championships 1927 - Wikipedia Found 7 tables to analyze Analyzing Table 1: Headers: ['Host city', 'Country', 'Events', 'Opening', 'Closing'] Rows: 6 Execution error: NameError: name 'table_text' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/xushiyue.6/codes/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ‰ΩøÁî®Áã¨Á´ãÁöÑ locals ~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 77, in <module> File "<string>", line 77, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'table_text' is not defined

Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print("=== 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION (FIXED) ===") print("Target: Extract specific gold medalists with names, events, and birth countries") print("Focus: Individual winners from Sweden and Italy with biographical information\n") # Check what files are available in workspace workspace_path = 'workspace' if os.path.exists(workspace_path): print("Files available in workspace:") for file in os.listdir(workspace_path): print(f" - {file}") else: print("No workspace directory found") exit() # Focus on the most relevant files for 1927 championship data target_files = [ 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html' ] print(f"\n=== PARSING 1927 CHAMPIONSHIP FILES FOR GOLD MEDALISTS ===") all_gold_medalists = [] for target_file in target_files: file_path = f'workspace/{target_file}' if os.path.exists(file_path): print(f"\nParsing: {target_file}") with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title for context title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'Unknown title' print(f"Page title: {title_text}") # Look for tables that might contain results tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Found {len(tables)} tables to analyze") # Analyze each table for medal results for table_idx, table in enumerate(tables, 1): print(f"\n Analyzing Table {table_idx}:") # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts[:6]}") # Get all rows rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Rows: {len(rows)}") # FIX: Define table_text properly in scope table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Check if this table contains medal/result information has_medal_info = any(keyword in table_text for keyword in ['gold', 'medal', 'winner', '1st', 'first']) has_country_info = any(keyword in table_text for keyword in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']) print(f" Contains medal info: {has_medal_info}") print(f" Contains Sweden/Italy info: {has_country_info}") if has_medal_info or has_country_info: print(f" *** ANALYZING TABLE {table_idx} IN DETAIL ***") # Show sample of table content for debugging print(f" Table content sample: {table_text[:200]}...") # Extract data from each row for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] if len(cell_texts) > 1: # Skip empty rows row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts).lower() # Look for gold medal indicators is_gold_row = any(indicator in row_text for indicator in ['gold', '1st', 'first', 'winner']) has_sweden_italy = any(country in row_text for country in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita', 'swedish', 'italian']) if is_gold_row or has_sweden_italy: print(f" Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Try to extract structured information potential_medalist = { 'source_file': target_file, 'table_index': table_idx, 'row_index': row_idx, 'raw_data': cell_texts, 'is_gold_medal': is_gold_row, 'involves_sweden_italy': has_sweden_italy } # Try to identify name, event, and country name = None event = None country = None for cell in cell_texts: # Look for names (capitalized words) name_pattern = re.findall(r'[A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+', cell) if name_pattern and not name: name = name_pattern[0] # Look for countries if any(c in cell.lower() for c in ['sweden', 'swe', 'swedish']): country = 'Sweden' elif any(c in cell.lower() for c in ['italy', 'ita', 'italian']): country = 'Italy' # Look for ski events if any(event_word in cell.lower() for event_word in ['ski', 'jump', 'cross', 'nordic', 'combined']): if not event: event = cell potential_medalist.update({ 'extracted_name': name, 'extracted_event': event, 'extracted_country': country }) all_gold_medalists.append(potential_medalist) if is_gold_row and (name or country): print(f" *** POTENTIAL GOLD MEDALIST FOUND ***") print(f" Name: {name}") print(f" Event: {event}") print(f" Country: {country}") # Also look for text sections that might mention gold medalists print(f"\n Searching text content for additional gold medalist mentions:") text_content = soup.get_text() # Look for sections with "Results" or "Medal" headers result_sections = soup.find_all(['h2', 'h3', 'h4'], string=re.compile(r'Results?|Medal|Winner|Champion', re.IGNORECASE)) print(f" Found {len(result_sections)} result/medal sections") for section in result_sections: print(f" Section: {section.get_text().strip()}") # Get content after this section next_elements = [] current = section.next_sibling count = 0 while current and count < 10: # Look at next 10 elements if hasattr(current, 'get_text'): text = current.get_text().strip() if text and len(text) > 10: next_elements.append(text) # Check if this mentions Sweden or Italy with names if any(country in text.lower() for country in ['sweden', 'italy']) and any(indicator in text.lower() for indicator in ['gold', 'first', '1st']): print(f" Relevant content: {text[:150]}...") current = current.next_sibling count += 1 # Look for patterns like "Gold: Name (Country)" or similar gold_patterns = [ r'Gold[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)', r'1st[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)', r'Winner[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)' ] for pattern in gold_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content) for match in matches: name, country_info = match print(f" Pattern match - Name: {name}, Country: {country_info}") # Check if this involves Sweden or Italy if any(c in country_info.lower() for c in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']): text_medalist = { 'source_file': target_file, 'extraction_method': 'text_pattern', 'extracted_name': name, 'extracted_country': country_info, 'raw_match': f"{name} ({country_info})" } all_gold_medalists.append(text_medalist) print(f" *** SWEDEN/ITALY GOLD MEDALIST FROM TEXT: {name} ({country_info}) ***") else: print(f"File not found: {target_file}") print(f"\n=== GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION SUMMARY ===") print(f"Total potential medalists extracted: {len(all_gold_medalists)}") # Filter and organize results gold_medalists_sweden_italy = [] for medalist in all_gold_medalists: country = medalist.get('extracted_country', '') if country and any(c in country.lower() for c in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']): gold_medalists_sweden_italy.append(medalist) print(f"Gold medalists from Sweden/Italy: {len(gold_medalists_sweden_italy)}") if gold_medalists_sweden_italy: print("\nDetailed results:") for i, medalist in enumerate(gold_medalists_sweden_italy, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {medalist.get('extracted_name', 'Name not extracted')}") print(f" Country: {medalist.get('extracted_country', 'Country not extracted')}") print(f" Event: {medalist.get('extracted_event', 'Event not extracted')}") print(f" Source: {medalist.get('source_file', 'Unknown source')}") print(f" Raw data: {medalist.get('raw_data', medalist.get('raw_match', 'No raw data'))}") else: print("\nNo gold medalists from Sweden or Italy clearly identified in the parsed content.") print("Let me check what content was actually found...") # Show all extracted medalists for debugging if all_gold_medalists: print("\nAll potential medalists found (for debugging):") for i, medalist in enumerate(all_gold_medalists[:5], 1): # Show first 5 print(f"\n{i}. Raw data: {medalist.get('raw_data', 'No raw data')}") print(f" Extracted name: {medalist.get('extracted_name', 'None')}") print(f" Extracted country: {medalist.get('extracted_country', 'None')}") print(f" Is gold medal: {medalist.get('is_gold_medal', False)}") # Save extraction results extraction_results = { 'extraction_timestamp': '2024-01-01', 'target_championship': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships', 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo', 'focus_countries': ['Sweden', 'Italy'], 'total_potential_medalists': len(all_gold_medalists), 'sweden_italy_medalists': len(gold_medalists_sweden_italy), 'detailed_results': all_gold_medalists, 'sweden_italy_only': gold_medalists_sweden_italy } with open('workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_extraction.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(extraction_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nExtraction results saved to: workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_extraction.json") print(f"Ready for next phase: Detailed biographical research on identified medalists")
Execution Output
Code Output: === 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION (FIXED) === Target: Extract specific gold medalists with names, events, and birth countries Focus: Individual winners from Sweden and Italy with biographical information Files available in workspace: - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html - fis_1927_file_analysis.json - fis_cortina_championship_final_results.json - fis_cortina_research_summary.json - www_fis-ski_com.html - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html - cortina_research_summary.json - fis_1927_research_summary.json - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Cortina_d_Ampezzo.html - fis_cortina_final_answer.json === PARSING 1927 CHAMPIONSHIP FILES FOR GOLD MEDALISTS === Parsing: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html Page title: FIS Nordic World Ski Championships 1927 - Wikipedia Found 7 tables to analyze Analyzing Table 1: Headers: ['Host city', 'Country', 'Events', 'Opening', 'Closing'] Rows: 6 Execution error: NameError: name 'table_text' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/xushiyue.6/codes/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ‰ΩøÁî®Áã¨Á´ãÁöÑ locals ~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 67, in <module> File "<string>", line 67, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'table_text' is not defined

Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code crashed with NameError: name 'table_text' is not defined on line 67. The error occurs because 'table_text' is referenced in the list comprehension on line 67 but is defined later on line 70. The code successfully loaded the HTML file and found 7 tables to analyze, but crashed when trying to check if tables contain medal information. **PLAN** alignment: 15% - file loading and initial parsing worked, but no gold medalist data extracted due to variable scope error. Recommended fix: Move the line 'table_text = table.get_text().lower()' to before line 67 where it's first used, or restructure the code to define table_text before referencing it in the medal detection logic.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print("=== 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION (FIXED) ===") print("Target: Extract specific gold medalists with names, events, and birth countries") print("Focus: Individual winners from Sweden and Italy with biographical information\n") # Check what files are available in workspace workspace_path = 'workspace' if os.path.exists(workspace_path): print("Files available in workspace:") for file in os.listdir(workspace_path): print(f" - {file}") else: print("No workspace directory found") exit() # Focus on the most relevant files for 1927 championship data target_files = [ 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html' ] print(f"\n=== PARSING 1927 CHAMPIONSHIP FILES FOR GOLD MEDALISTS ===") all_gold_medalists = [] for target_file in target_files: file_path = f'workspace/{target_file}' if os.path.exists(file_path): print(f"\nParsing: {target_file}") with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title for context title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'Unknown title' print(f"Page title: {title_text}") # Look for tables that might contain results tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Found {len(tables)} tables to analyze") # Analyze each table for medal results for table_idx, table in enumerate(tables, 1): print(f"\n Analyzing Table {table_idx}:") # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts[:6]}") # Get all rows rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Rows: {len(rows)}") # FIX: Define table_text properly in scope table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Check if this table contains medal/result information has_medal_info = any(keyword in table_text for keyword in ['gold', 'medal', 'winner', '1st', 'first']) has_country_info = any(keyword in table_text for keyword in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']) print(f" Contains medal info: {has_medal_info}") print(f" Contains Sweden/Italy info: {has_country_info}") if has_medal_info or has_country_info: print(f" *** ANALYZING TABLE {table_idx} IN DETAIL ***") # Show sample of table content for debugging print(f" Table content sample: {table_text[:200]}...") # Extract data from each row for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] if len(cell_texts) > 1: # Skip empty rows row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts).lower() # Look for gold medal indicators is_gold_row = any(indicator in row_text for indicator in ['gold', '1st', 'first', 'winner']) has_sweden_italy = any(country in row_text for country in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita', 'swedish', 'italian']) if is_gold_row or has_sweden_italy: print(f" Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Try to extract structured information potential_medalist = { 'source_file': target_file, 'table_index': table_idx, 'row_index': row_idx, 'raw_data': cell_texts, 'is_gold_medal': is_gold_row, 'involves_sweden_italy': has_sweden_italy } # Try to identify name, event, and country name = None event = None country = None for cell in cell_texts: # Look for names (capitalized words) name_pattern = re.findall(r'[A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+', cell) if name_pattern and not name: name = name_pattern[0] # Look for countries if any(c in cell.lower() for c in ['sweden', 'swe', 'swedish']): country = 'Sweden' elif any(c in cell.lower() for c in ['italy', 'ita', 'italian']): country = 'Italy' # Look for ski events if any(event_word in cell.lower() for event_word in ['ski', 'jump', 'cross', 'nordic', 'combined']): if not event: event = cell potential_medalist.update({ 'extracted_name': name, 'extracted_event': event, 'extracted_country': country }) all_gold_medalists.append(potential_medalist) if is_gold_row and (name or country): print(f" *** POTENTIAL GOLD MEDALIST FOUND ***") print(f" Name: {name}") print(f" Event: {event}") print(f" Country: {country}") # Also look for text sections that might mention gold medalists print(f"\n Searching text content for additional gold medalist mentions:") text_content = soup.get_text() # Look for sections with "Results" or "Medal" headers result_sections = soup.find_all(['h2', 'h3', 'h4'], string=re.compile(r'Results?|Medal|Winner|Champion', re.IGNORECASE)) print(f" Found {len(result_sections)} result/medal sections") for section in result_sections: print(f" Section: {section.get_text().strip()}") # Get content after this section next_elements = [] current = section.next_sibling count = 0 while current and count < 10: # Look at next 10 elements if hasattr(current, 'get_text'): text = current.get_text().strip() if text and len(text) > 10: next_elements.append(text) # Check if this mentions Sweden or Italy with names if any(country in text.lower() for country in ['sweden', 'italy']) and any(indicator in text.lower() for indicator in ['gold', 'first', '1st']): print(f" Relevant content: {text[:150]}...") current = current.next_sibling count += 1 # Look for patterns like "Gold: Name (Country)" or similar gold_patterns = [ r'Gold[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)', r'1st[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)', r'Winner[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)' ] for pattern in gold_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content) for match in matches: name, country_info = match print(f" Pattern match - Name: {name}, Country: {country_info}") # Check if this involves Sweden or Italy if any(c in country_info.lower() for c in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']): text_medalist = { 'source_file': target_file, 'extraction_method': 'text_pattern', 'extracted_name': name, 'extracted_country': country_info, 'raw_match': f"{name} ({country_info})" } all_gold_medalists.append(text_medalist) print(f" *** SWEDEN/ITALY GOLD MEDALIST FROM TEXT: {name} ({country_info}) ***") else: print(f"File not found: {target_file}") print(f"\n=== GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION SUMMARY ===") print(f"Total potential medalists extracted: {len(all_gold_medalists)}") # Filter and organize results gold_medalists_sweden_italy = [] for medalist in all_gold_medalists: country = medalist.get('extracted_country', '') if country and any(c in country.lower() for c in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']): gold_medalists_sweden_italy.append(medalist) print(f"Gold medalists from Sweden/Italy: {len(gold_medalists_sweden_italy)}") if gold_medalists_sweden_italy: print("\nDetailed results:") for i, medalist in enumerate(gold_medalists_sweden_italy, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {medalist.get('extracted_name', 'Name not extracted')}") print(f" Country: {medalist.get('extracted_country', 'Country not extracted')}") print(f" Event: {medalist.get('extracted_event', 'Event not extracted')}") print(f" Source: {medalist.get('source_file', 'Unknown source')}") print(f" Raw data: {medalist.get('raw_data', medalist.get('raw_match', 'No raw data'))}") else: print("\nNo gold medalists from Sweden or Italy clearly identified in the parsed content.") print("Let me check what content was actually found...") # Show all extracted medalists for debugging if all_gold_medalists: print("\nAll potential medalists found (for debugging):") for i, medalist in enumerate(all_gold_medalists[:5], 1): # Show first 5 print(f"\n{i}. Raw data: {medalist.get('raw_data', 'No raw data')}") print(f" Extracted name: {medalist.get('extracted_name', 'None')}") print(f" Extracted country: {medalist.get('extracted_country', 'None')}") print(f" Is gold medal: {medalist.get('is_gold_medal', False)}") # Save extraction results extraction_results = { 'extraction_timestamp': '2024-01-01', 'target_championship': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships', 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo', 'focus_countries': ['Sweden', 'Italy'], 'total_potential_medalists': len(all_gold_medalists), 'sweden_italy_medalists': len(gold_medalists_sweden_italy), 'detailed_results': all_gold_medalists, 'sweden_italy_only': gold_medalists_sweden_italy } with open('workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_extraction.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(extraction_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nExtraction results saved to: workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_extraction.json") print(f"Ready for next phase: Detailed biographical research on identified medalists")
Execution Output
Code Output: === 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION (FIXED) === Target: Extract specific gold medalists with names, events, and birth countries Focus: Individual winners from Sweden and Italy with biographical information Files available in workspace: - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html - fis_1927_file_analysis.json - fis_cortina_championship_final_results.json - fis_cortina_research_summary.json - www_fis-ski_com.html - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html - cortina_research_summary.json - fis_1927_research_summary.json - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Cortina_d_Ampezzo.html - fis_cortina_final_answer.json === PARSING 1927 CHAMPIONSHIP FILES FOR GOLD MEDALISTS === Parsing: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html Page title: FIS Nordic World Ski Championships 1927 - Wikipedia Found 7 tables to analyze Analyzing Table 1: Headers: ['Host city', 'Country', 'Events', 'Opening', 'Closing'] Rows: 6 Execution error: NameError: name 'table_text' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/xushiyue.6/codes/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ‰ΩøÁî®Áã¨Á´ãÁöÑ locals ~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 67, in <module> File "<string>", line 67, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'table_text' is not defined
