2025-08-12 03:39:48
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 6)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print("=== 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION (SCOPE FIXED) ===") print("Target: Extract specific gold medalists with names, events, and birth countries") print("Focus: Individual winners from Sweden and Italy with biographical information\n") # Check what files are available in workspace workspace_path = 'workspace' if os.path.exists(workspace_path): print("Files available in workspace:") for file in os.listdir(workspace_path): print(f" - {file}") else: print("No workspace directory found") exit() # Focus on the most relevant files for 1927 championship data target_files = [ 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html' ] print(f"\n=== PARSING 1927 CHAMPIONSHIP FILES FOR GOLD MEDALISTS ===") all_gold_medalists = [] for target_file in target_files: file_path = f'workspace/{target_file}' if os.path.exists(file_path): print(f"\nParsing: {target_file}") with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title for context title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'Unknown title' print(f"Page title: {title_text}") # Look for tables that might contain results tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Found {len(tables)} tables to analyze") # Analyze each table for medal results for table_idx, table in enumerate(tables, 1): print(f"\n Analyzing Table {table_idx}:") # FIX: Define table_text FIRST before using it table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts[:6]}") # Get all rows rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Rows: {len(rows)}") # Check if this table contains medal/result information medal_keywords = ['gold', 'medal', 'winner', '1st', 'first'] country_keywords = ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita'] has_medal_info = any(keyword in table_text for keyword in medal_keywords) has_country_info = any(keyword in table_text for keyword in country_keywords) print(f" Contains medal info: {has_medal_info}") print(f" Contains Sweden/Italy info: {has_country_info}") if has_medal_info or has_country_info: print(f" *** ANALYZING TABLE {table_idx} IN DETAIL ***") # Show sample of table content for debugging print(f" Table content sample: {table_text[:200]}...") # Extract data from each row for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] if len(cell_texts) > 1: # Skip empty rows row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts).lower() # Look for gold medal indicators is_gold_row = any(indicator in row_text for indicator in medal_keywords) has_sweden_italy = any(country in row_text for country in country_keywords + ['swedish', 'italian']) if is_gold_row or has_sweden_italy: print(f" Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Try to extract structured information potential_medalist = { 'source_file': target_file, 'table_index': table_idx, 'row_index': row_idx, 'raw_data': cell_texts, 'is_gold_medal': is_gold_row, 'involves_sweden_italy': has_sweden_italy } # Try to identify name, event, and country name = None event = None country = None for cell in cell_texts: # Look for names (capitalized words) name_pattern = re.findall(r'[A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+', cell) if name_pattern and not name: name = name_pattern[0] # Look for countries cell_lower = cell.lower() if any(c in cell_lower for c in ['sweden', 'swe', 'swedish']): country = 'Sweden' elif any(c in cell_lower for c in ['italy', 'ita', 'italian']): country = 'Italy' # Look for ski events if any(event_word in cell_lower for event_word in ['ski', 'jump', 'cross', 'nordic', 'combined']): if not event: event = cell potential_medalist.update({ 'extracted_name': name, 'extracted_event': event, 'extracted_country': country }) all_gold_medalists.append(potential_medalist) if is_gold_row and (name or country): print(f" *** POTENTIAL GOLD MEDALIST FOUND ***") print(f" Name: {name}") print(f" Event: {event}") print(f" Country: {country}") # Also look for text sections that might mention gold medalists print(f"\n Searching text content for additional gold medalist mentions:") text_content = soup.get_text() # Look for sections with "Results" or "Medal" headers result_sections = soup.find_all(['h2', 'h3', 'h4'], string=re.compile(r'Results?|Medal|Winner|Champion', re.IGNORECASE)) print(f" Found {len(result_sections)} result/medal sections") for section in result_sections: print(f" Section: {section.get_text().strip()}") # Get content after this section next_elements = [] current = section.next_sibling count = 0 while current and count < 10: # Look at next 10 elements if hasattr(current, 'get_text'): text = current.get_text().strip() if text and len(text) > 10: next_elements.append(text) # Check if this mentions Sweden or Italy with names text_lower = text.lower() if any(country in text_lower for country in ['sweden', 'italy']) and any(indicator in text_lower for indicator in ['gold', 'first', '1st']): print(f" Relevant content: {text[:150]}...") current = current.next_sibling count += 1 # Look for patterns like "Gold: Name (Country)" or similar gold_patterns = [ r'Gold[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)', r'1st[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)', r'Winner[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)' ] for pattern in gold_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content) for match in matches: name, country_info = match print(f" Pattern match - Name: {name}, Country: {country_info}") # Check if this involves Sweden or Italy if any(c in country_info.lower() for c in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']): text_medalist = { 'source_file': target_file, 'extraction_method': 'text_pattern', 'extracted_name': name, 'extracted_country': country_info, 'raw_match': f"{name} ({country_info})" } all_gold_medalists.append(text_medalist) print(f" *** SWEDEN/ITALY GOLD MEDALIST FROM TEXT: {name} ({country_info}) ***") else: print(f"File not found: {target_file}") print(f"\n=== GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION SUMMARY ===") print(f"Total potential medalists extracted: {len(all_gold_medalists)}") # Filter and organize results gold_medalists_sweden_italy = [] for medalist in all_gold_medalists: country = medalist.get('extracted_country', '') if country and any(c in country.lower() for c in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']): gold_medalists_sweden_italy.append(medalist) print(f"Gold medalists from Sweden/Italy: {len(gold_medalists_sweden_italy)}") if gold_medalists_sweden_italy: print("\nDetailed results:") for i, medalist in enumerate(gold_medalists_sweden_italy, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {medalist.get('extracted_name', 'Name not extracted')}") print(f" Country: {medalist.get('extracted_country', 'Country not extracted')}") print(f" Event: {medalist.get('extracted_event', 'Event not extracted')}") print(f" Source: {medalist.get('source_file', 'Unknown source')}") print(f" Raw data: {medalist.get('raw_data', medalist.get('raw_match', 'No raw data'))}") else: print("\nNo gold medalists from Sweden or Italy clearly identified in the parsed content.") print("Let me check what content was actually found...") # Show all extracted medalists for debugging if all_gold_medalists: print("\nAll potential medalists found (for debugging):") for i, medalist in enumerate(all_gold_medalists[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f"\n{i}. Raw data: {medalist.get('raw_data', 'No raw data')}") print(f" Extracted name: {medalist.get('extracted_name', 'None')}") print(f" Extracted country: {medalist.get('extracted_country', 'None')}") print(f" Is gold medal: {medalist.get('is_gold_medal', False)}") print(f" Involves Sweden/Italy: {medalist.get('involves_sweden_italy', False)}") else: print("\nNo potential medalists found at all. Let me check the table structure...") # If no medalists found, let's examine the first file's table structure more closely first_file = f'workspace/{target_files[0]}' if os.path.exists(first_file): with open(first_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"\nDetailed table structure analysis for {target_files[0]}:") for i, table in enumerate(tables[:3], 1): # Examine first 3 tables print(f"\nTable {i}:") rows = table.find_all('tr') for j, row in enumerate(rows[:5], 1): # Show first 5 rows cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] print(f" Row {j}: {cell_texts}") # Save extraction results extraction_results = { 'extraction_timestamp': '2024-01-01', 'target_championship': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships', 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo', 'focus_countries': ['Sweden', 'Italy'], 'total_potential_medalists': len(all_gold_medalists), 'sweden_italy_medalists': len(gold_medalists_sweden_italy), 'detailed_results': all_gold_medalists, 'sweden_italy_only': gold_medalists_sweden_italy } with open('workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_extraction.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(extraction_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nExtraction results saved to: workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_extraction.json") print(f"Ready for next phase: Detailed biographical research on identified medalists")
Execution Output
Code Output: === 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION (SCOPE FIXED) === Target: Extract specific gold medalists with names, events, and birth countries Focus: Individual winners from Sweden and Italy with biographical information Files available in workspace: - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html - fis_1927_file_analysis.json - fis_cortina_championship_final_results.json - fis_cortina_research_summary.json - www_fis-ski_com.html - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html - cortina_research_summary.json - fis_1927_research_summary.json - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Cortina_d_Ampezzo.html - fis_cortina_final_answer.json === PARSING 1927 CHAMPIONSHIP FILES FOR GOLD MEDALISTS === Parsing: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html Page title: FIS Nordic World Ski Championships 1927 - Wikipedia Found 7 tables to analyze Analyzing Table 1: Headers: ['Host city', 'Country', 'Events', 'Opening', 'Closing'] Rows: 6 Execution error: NameError: name 'table_text' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/xushiyue.6/codes/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ‰ΩøÁî®Áã¨Á´ãÁöÑ locals ~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 70, in <module> File "<string>", line 70, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'table_text' is not defined
tester
2025-08-12 03:39:48
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code crashed with the same NameError: name 'table_text' is not defined on line 70. Despite the comment 'FIX: Define table_text FIRST before using it', the variable is still being referenced before it's defined. The error occurs in a list comprehension that checks for medal keywords, where 'table_text' is used but hasn't been initialized yet. The code successfully loaded the HTML file and found 7 tables to analyze, but crashes during the medal detection phase. **PLAN** alignment: 15% - file loading works but no gold medalist extraction completed. Recommended fix: Move the line 'table_text = table.get_text().lower()' to immediately after the table loop starts (before line 70) to ensure it's defined before any usage in the medal keyword detection logic.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print("=== 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION (SCOPE FIXED) ===") print("Target: Extract specific gold medalists with names, events, and birth countries") print("Focus: Individual winners from Sweden and Italy with biographical information\n") # Check what files are available in workspace workspace_path = 'workspace' if os.path.exists(workspace_path): print("Files available in workspace:") for file in os.listdir(workspace_path): print(f" - {file}") else: print("No workspace directory found") exit() # Focus on the most relevant files for 1927 championship data target_files = [ 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html' ] print(f"\n=== PARSING 1927 CHAMPIONSHIP FILES FOR GOLD MEDALISTS ===") all_gold_medalists = [] for target_file in target_files: file_path = f'workspace/{target_file}' if os.path.exists(file_path): print(f"\nParsing: {target_file}") with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title for context title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'Unknown title' print(f"Page title: {title_text}") # Look for tables that might contain results tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"Found {len(tables)} tables to analyze") # Analyze each table for medal results for table_idx, table in enumerate(tables, 1): print(f"\n Analyzing Table {table_idx}:") # FIX: Define table_text FIRST before using it table_text = table.get_text().lower() # Get table headers headers = table.find_all('th') header_texts = [th.get_text().strip() for th in headers] print(f" Headers: {header_texts[:6]}") # Get all rows rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f" Rows: {len(rows)}") # Check if this table contains medal/result information medal_keywords = ['gold', 'medal', 'winner', '1st', 'first'] country_keywords = ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita'] has_medal_info = any(keyword in table_text for keyword in medal_keywords) has_country_info = any(keyword in table_text for keyword in country_keywords) print(f" Contains medal info: {has_medal_info}") print(f" Contains Sweden/Italy info: {has_country_info}") if has_medal_info or has_country_info: print(f" *** ANALYZING TABLE {table_idx} IN DETAIL ***") # Show sample of table content for debugging print(f" Table content sample: {table_text[:200]}...") # Extract data from each row for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows): cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] if len(cell_texts) > 1: # Skip empty rows row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts).lower() # Look for gold medal indicators is_gold_row = any(indicator in row_text for indicator in medal_keywords) has_sweden_italy = any(country in row_text for country in country_keywords + ['swedish', 'italian']) if is_gold_row or has_sweden_italy: print(f" Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}") # Try to extract structured information potential_medalist = { 'source_file': target_file, 'table_index': table_idx, 'row_index': row_idx, 'raw_data': cell_texts, 'is_gold_medal': is_gold_row, 'involves_sweden_italy': has_sweden_italy } # Try to identify name, event, and country name = None event = None country = None for cell in cell_texts: # Look for names (capitalized words) name_pattern = re.findall(r'[A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+', cell) if name_pattern and not name: name = name_pattern[0] # Look for countries cell_lower = cell.lower() if any(c in cell_lower for c in ['sweden', 'swe', 'swedish']): country = 'Sweden' elif any(c in cell_lower for c in ['italy', 'ita', 'italian']): country = 'Italy' # Look for ski events if any(event_word in cell_lower for event_word in ['ski', 'jump', 'cross', 'nordic', 'combined']): if not event: event = cell potential_medalist.update({ 'extracted_name': name, 'extracted_event': event, 'extracted_country': country }) all_gold_medalists.append(potential_medalist) if is_gold_row and (name or country): print(f" *** POTENTIAL GOLD MEDALIST FOUND ***") print(f" Name: {name}") print(f" Event: {event}") print(f" Country: {country}") # Also look for text sections that might mention gold medalists print(f"\n Searching text content for additional gold medalist mentions:") text_content = soup.get_text() # Look for sections with "Results" or "Medal" headers result_sections = soup.find_all(['h2', 'h3', 'h4'], string=re.compile(r'Results?|Medal|Winner|Champion', re.IGNORECASE)) print(f" Found {len(result_sections)} result/medal sections") for section in result_sections: print(f" Section: {section.get_text().strip()}") # Get content after this section next_elements = [] current = section.next_sibling count = 0 while current and count < 10: # Look at next 10 elements if hasattr(current, 'get_text'): text = current.get_text().strip() if text and len(text) > 10: next_elements.append(text) # Check if this mentions Sweden or Italy with names text_lower = text.lower() if any(country in text_lower for country in ['sweden', 'italy']) and any(indicator in text_lower for indicator in ['gold', 'first', '1st']): print(f" Relevant content: {text[:150]}...") current = current.next_sibling count += 1 # Look for patterns like "Gold: Name (Country)" or similar gold_patterns = [ r'Gold[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)', r'1st[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)', r'Winner[:\s]+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(([^)]+)\)' ] for pattern in gold_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, text_content) for match in matches: name, country_info = match print(f" Pattern match - Name: {name}, Country: {country_info}") # Check if this involves Sweden or Italy if any(c in country_info.lower() for c in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']): text_medalist = { 'source_file': target_file, 'extraction_method': 'text_pattern', 'extracted_name': name, 'extracted_country': country_info, 'raw_match': f"{name} ({country_info})" } all_gold_medalists.append(text_medalist) print(f" *** SWEDEN/ITALY GOLD MEDALIST FROM TEXT: {name} ({country_info}) ***") else: print(f"File not found: {target_file}") print(f"\n=== GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION SUMMARY ===") print(f"Total potential medalists extracted: {len(all_gold_medalists)}") # Filter and organize results gold_medalists_sweden_italy = [] for medalist in all_gold_medalists: country = medalist.get('extracted_country', '') if country and any(c in country.lower() for c in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']): gold_medalists_sweden_italy.append(medalist) print(f"Gold medalists from Sweden/Italy: {len(gold_medalists_sweden_italy)}") if gold_medalists_sweden_italy: print("\nDetailed results:") for i, medalist in enumerate(gold_medalists_sweden_italy, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {medalist.get('extracted_name', 'Name not extracted')}") print(f" Country: {medalist.get('extracted_country', 'Country not extracted')}") print(f" Event: {medalist.get('extracted_event', 'Event not extracted')}") print(f" Source: {medalist.get('source_file', 'Unknown source')}") print(f" Raw data: {medalist.get('raw_data', medalist.get('raw_match', 'No raw data'))}") else: print("\nNo gold medalists from Sweden or Italy clearly identified in the parsed content.") print("Let me check what content was actually found...") # Show all extracted medalists for debugging if all_gold_medalists: print("\nAll potential medalists found (for debugging):") for i, medalist in enumerate(all_gold_medalists[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f"\n{i}. Raw data: {medalist.get('raw_data', 'No raw data')}") print(f" Extracted name: {medalist.get('extracted_name', 'None')}") print(f" Extracted country: {medalist.get('extracted_country', 'None')}") print(f" Is gold medal: {medalist.get('is_gold_medal', False)}") print(f" Involves Sweden/Italy: {medalist.get('involves_sweden_italy', False)}") else: print("\nNo potential medalists found at all. Let me check the table structure...") # If no medalists found, let's examine the first file's table structure more closely first_file = f'workspace/{target_files[0]}' if os.path.exists(first_file): with open(first_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f"\nDetailed table structure analysis for {target_files[0]}:") for i, table in enumerate(tables[:3], 1): # Examine first 3 tables print(f"\nTable {i}:") rows = table.find_all('tr') for j, row in enumerate(rows[:5], 1): # Show first 5 rows cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] print(f" Row {j}: {cell_texts}") # Save extraction results extraction_results = { 'extraction_timestamp': '2024-01-01', 'target_championship': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships', 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo', 'focus_countries': ['Sweden', 'Italy'], 'total_potential_medalists': len(all_gold_medalists), 'sweden_italy_medalists': len(gold_medalists_sweden_italy), 'detailed_results': all_gold_medalists, 'sweden_italy_only': gold_medalists_sweden_italy } with open('workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_extraction.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(extraction_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nExtraction results saved to: workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_extraction.json") print(f"Ready for next phase: Detailed biographical research on identified medalists")
Execution Output
Code Output: === 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: GOLD MEDALIST EXTRACTION (SCOPE FIXED) === Target: Extract specific gold medalists with names, events, and birth countries Focus: Individual winners from Sweden and Italy with biographical information Files available in workspace: - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html - fis_1927_file_analysis.json - fis_cortina_championship_final_results.json - fis_cortina_research_summary.json - www_fis-ski_com.html - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html - cortina_research_summary.json - fis_1927_research_summary.json - en_wikipedia_org_wiki_Cortina_d_Ampezzo.html - fis_cortina_final_answer.json === PARSING 1927 CHAMPIONSHIP FILES FOR GOLD MEDALISTS === Parsing: en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html Page title: FIS Nordic World Ski Championships 1927 - Wikipedia Found 7 tables to analyze Analyzing Table 1: Headers: ['Host city', 'Country', 'Events', 'Opening', 'Closing'] Rows: 6 Execution error: NameError: name 'table_text' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/xushiyue.6/codes/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ‰ΩøÁî®Áã¨Á´ãÁöÑ locals ~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 70, in <module> File "<string>", line 70, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'table_text' is not defined

2025-08-12 03:40:52
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 7)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print('=== 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: COMPREHENSIVE DATA EXTRACTION ===') print('Target: Extract gold medalists with birth countries from Cortina d\'Ampezzo 1927') print('Focus: Complete list of individual winners from Sweden and Italy with birthplaces\n') # First, let's inspect existing JSON files that might already contain relevant data workspace_path = 'workspace' print('=== INSPECTING EXISTING JSON FILES FOR RELEVANT DATA ===') json_files = [f for f in os.listdir(workspace_path) if f.endswith('.json')] print(f'Found {len(json_files)} JSON files to inspect:') for json_file in json_files: print(f'\n--- Examining {json_file} ---') file_path = os.path.join(workspace_path, json_file) try: with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f'File type: {type(data)}') if isinstance(data, dict): print(f'Top-level keys: {list(data.keys())}') # Look for any content related to 1927, gold medals, or medalists json_str = json.dumps(data, ensure_ascii=False).lower() mentions_1927 = json_str.count('1927') mentions_gold = json_str.count('gold') mentions_medal = json_str.count('medal') mentions_sweden = json_str.count('sweden') mentions_italy = json_str.count('italy') print(f'Content analysis:') print(f' 1927 mentions: {mentions_1927}') print(f' Gold mentions: {mentions_gold}') print(f' Medal mentions: {mentions_medal}') print(f' Sweden mentions: {mentions_sweden}') print(f' Italy mentions: {mentions_italy}') if mentions_1927 > 0 or mentions_gold > 0: print(' *** POTENTIALLY RELEVANT FILE ***') # Show a sample of the content for key, value in data.items(): if isinstance(value, (str, int, float)): print(f' {key}: {value}') elif isinstance(value, list) and len(value) > 0: print(f' {key}: List with {len(value)} items') if len(value) > 0: print(f' Sample item: {value[0]}') elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f' {key}: Dict with keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}') elif isinstance(data, list): print(f'List with {len(data)} items') if len(data) > 0: print(f'First item type: {type(data[0])}') if isinstance(data[0], dict): print(f'First item keys: {list(data[0].keys())}') except Exception as e: print(f'Error reading {json_file}: {e}') print('\n=== PARSING HTML FILES WITH SIMPLIFIED APPROACH ===') # Now let's parse the HTML files with a much simpler approach to avoid scope issues target_files = [ 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html' ] all_medalists = [] for target_file in target_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_path, target_file) if os.path.exists(file_path): print(f'\nParsing: {target_file}') with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'Unknown title' print(f'Page title: {title_text}') # Simple approach: Get all text and look for patterns full_text = soup.get_text() lines = full_text.split('\n') print(f'Total lines in document: {len(lines)}') # Look for lines containing both medal/winner info and country info relevant_lines = [] for line_num, line in enumerate(lines): line_clean = line.strip() if len(line_clean) < 5: # Skip very short lines continue line_lower = line_clean.lower() # Check for medal/winner indicators has_medal_info = any(keyword in line_lower for keyword in ['gold', 'medal', 'winner', 'first', '1st', 'champion']) # Check for country indicators has_country_info = any(keyword in line_lower for keyword in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swedish', 'italian', 'swe', 'ita']) # Check for 1927 reference has_1927 = '1927' in line_lower if (has_medal_info and has_country_info) or (has_medal_info and has_1927) or (has_country_info and has_1927): relevant_lines.append({ 'line_number': line_num, 'content': line_clean, 'has_medal_info': has_medal_info, 'has_country_info': has_country_info, 'has_1927': has_1927 }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_lines)} potentially relevant lines') # Show the most promising lines for i, line_info in enumerate(relevant_lines[:10]): print(f' Line {line_info["line_number"]}: {line_info["content"][:100]}...') # Try to extract names from this line content = line_info['content'] # Look for names (two capitalized words) name_matches = re.findall(r'\b[A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+\b', content) if name_matches: print(f' Potential names: {name_matches}') # Create medalist entries for name in name_matches: medalist_entry = { 'source_file': target_file, 'line_number': line_info['line_number'], 'extracted_name': name, 'full_line': content, 'has_medal_info': line_info['has_medal_info'], 'has_country_info': line_info['has_country_info'], 'has_1927': line_info['has_1927'] } # Try to determine country content_lower = content.lower() if any(c in content_lower for c in ['sweden', 'swedish', 'swe']): medalist_entry['country'] = 'Sweden' elif any(c in content_lower for c in ['italy', 'italian', 'ita']): medalist_entry['country'] = 'Italy' else: medalist_entry['country'] = 'Unknown' all_medalists.append(medalist_entry) if line_info['has_medal_info'] and medalist_entry['country'] in ['Sweden', 'Italy']: print(f' *** POTENTIAL GOLD MEDALIST: {name} ({medalist_entry["country"]}) ***') # Also look for tables specifically tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f'\nFound {len(tables)} tables in {target_file}') for table_idx, table in enumerate(tables): # Simple table analysis without scope issues table_text_content = table.get_text() # Check if table contains relevant information table_lower = table_text_content.lower() has_medals = any(word in table_lower for word in ['gold', 'medal', 'winner', 'first']) has_countries = any(word in table_lower for word in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']) if has_medals or has_countries: print(f' Table {table_idx + 1}: Contains medals={has_medals}, countries={has_countries}') # Get all table rows rows = table.find_all('tr') for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows[:5]): # Show first 5 rows cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] if len(cell_texts) > 1: print(f' Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}') else: print(f'File not found: {target_file}') print(f'\n=== EXTRACTION SUMMARY ===') print(f'Total potential medalists found: {len(all_medalists)}') # Filter for Sweden and Italy sweden_italy_medalists = [m for m in all_medalists if m.get('country') in ['Sweden', 'Italy']] print(f'Medalists from Sweden/Italy: {len(sweden_italy_medalists)}') if sweden_italy_medalists: print('\nSweden/Italy medalists found:') for i, medalist in enumerate(sweden_italy_medalists, 1): print(f'\n{i}. {medalist["extracted_name"]} ({medalist["country"]})') print(f' Source: {medalist["source_file"]}') print(f' Context: {medalist["full_line"][:150]}...') print(f' Has medal info: {medalist["has_medal_info"]}') print(f' Has 1927 reference: {medalist["has_1927"]}') else: print('\nNo clear Sweden/Italy medalists identified.') print('Showing all potential medalists for analysis:') for i, medalist in enumerate(all_medalists[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. {medalist["extracted_name"]} ({medalist.get("country", "Unknown")})') print(f' Context: {medalist["full_line"][:100]}...') # Save results results = { 'championship': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships', 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo', 'extraction_method': 'Simplified text parsing', 'total_potential_medalists': len(all_medalists), 'sweden_italy_medalists': len(sweden_italy_medalists), 'all_medalists': all_medalists, 'sweden_italy_only': sweden_italy_medalists } with open('workspace/fis_1927_simplified_extraction.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nResults saved to: workspace/fis_1927_simplified_extraction.json') print('Next step: Analyze results and research birth countries of identified medalists')
Execution Output

Cortina d'Ampezzo will host the Winter Olympics for a second time when it co-hosts the 2026 Winter Olympics with Milan. The town is home to SG Cortina, a top league professional ice hockey team, and Cortina d'Ampezzo is also the start and end point of the annual Dolomites Gold Cup Race.", "The town is home to SG Cortina, a professional ice hockey team in Serie A1, Italy's top division. Cortina d'Ampezzo is also the start and end point of the annual Dolomites Gold Cup Race, a historical re-evocation event for production cars on public roads.[85] The town hosted the Red Bull Road Rage in 2009.[86]", "Among the distinguished sportsmen from Cortina d'Ampezzo itself are the skiers Enrico Colli, his younger brother Vincenzo, and Giuseppe Ghedina who competed in the 1924 Winter Olympics, Severino Menardi who participated in the 1932 and 1936 Winter Olympics,[96] and Stefania Constantini, gold-medalist curler in the 2022 Winter Olympics. Other local citizens include the climbers Angelo Dibona (1879‚Äì1956) and Lino Lacedelli (1925‚Äì2009), and the painter Luigi Gillarduzzi (1822‚Äì1856).[97]"], 'has_relevant_content': True} --- Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code crashed with NameError: name 'line_lower' is not defined on line 112. The error occurs in a list comprehension where 'line_lower' is referenced but was never defined in the current scope. The code successfully started parsing the first HTML file (FIS Nordic World Ski Championships 1927) and found 793 lines to analyze, but failed when trying to check for medal/winner indicators in the text lines. **PLAN** alignment: 20% - successfully inspected existing JSON files and found several potentially relevant files with 1927 championship data, and began HTML parsing, but crashed before extracting any specific gold medalist names or birth countries. Recommended fix: Define 'line_lower = line_clean.lower()' before the line that uses it in the medal info detection logic, or replace the undefined variable reference with the correct variable name 'line_clean.lower()'.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print('=== 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: COMPREHENSIVE DATA EXTRACTION ===') print('Target: Extract gold medalists with birth countries from Cortina d\'Ampezzo 1927') print('Focus: Complete list of individual winners from Sweden and Italy with birthplaces\n') # First, let's inspect existing JSON files that might already contain relevant data workspace_path = 'workspace' print('=== INSPECTING EXISTING JSON FILES FOR RELEVANT DATA ===') json_files = [f for f in os.listdir(workspace_path) if f.endswith('.json')] print(f'Found {len(json_files)} JSON files to inspect:') for json_file in json_files: print(f'\n--- Examining {json_file} ---') file_path = os.path.join(workspace_path, json_file) try: with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f'File type: {type(data)}') if isinstance(data, dict): print(f'Top-level keys: {list(data.keys())}') # Look for any content related to 1927, gold medals, or medalists json_str = json.dumps(data, ensure_ascii=False).lower() mentions_1927 = json_str.count('1927') mentions_gold = json_str.count('gold') mentions_medal = json_str.count('medal') mentions_sweden = json_str.count('sweden') mentions_italy = json_str.count('italy') print(f'Content analysis:') print(f' 1927 mentions: {mentions_1927}') print(f' Gold mentions: {mentions_gold}') print(f' Medal mentions: {mentions_medal}') print(f' Sweden mentions: {mentions_sweden}') print(f' Italy mentions: {mentions_italy}') if mentions_1927 > 0 or mentions_gold > 0: print(' *** POTENTIALLY RELEVANT FILE ***') # Show a sample of the content for key, value in data.items(): if isinstance(value, (str, int, float)): print(f' {key}: {value}') elif isinstance(value, list) and len(value) > 0: print(f' {key}: List with {len(value)} items') if len(value) > 0: print(f' Sample item: {value[0]}') elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f' {key}: Dict with keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}') elif isinstance(data, list): print(f'List with {len(data)} items') if len(data) > 0: print(f'First item type: {type(data[0])}') if isinstance(data[0], dict): print(f'First item keys: {list(data[0].keys())}') except Exception as e: print(f'Error reading {json_file}: {e}') print('\n=== PARSING HTML FILES WITH SIMPLIFIED APPROACH ===') # Now let's parse the HTML files with a much simpler approach to avoid scope issues target_files = [ 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html' ] all_medalists = [] for target_file in target_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_path, target_file) if os.path.exists(file_path): print(f'\nParsing: {target_file}') with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'Unknown title' print(f'Page title: {title_text}') # Simple approach: Get all text and look for patterns full_text = soup.get_text() lines = full_text.split('\n') print(f'Total lines in document: {len(lines)}') # Look for lines containing both medal/winner info and country info relevant_lines = [] for line_num, line in enumerate(lines): line_clean = line.strip() if len(line_clean) < 5: # Skip very short lines continue line_lower = line_clean.lower() # Check for medal/winner indicators has_medal_info = any(keyword in line_lower for keyword in ['gold', 'medal', 'winner', 'first', '1st', 'champion']) # Check for country indicators has_country_info = any(keyword in line_lower for keyword in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swedish', 'italian', 'swe', 'ita']) # Check for 1927 reference has_1927 = '1927' in line_lower if (has_medal_info and has_country_info) or (has_medal_info and has_1927) or (has_country_info and has_1927): relevant_lines.append({ 'line_number': line_num, 'content': line_clean, 'has_medal_info': has_medal_info, 'has_country_info': has_country_info, 'has_1927': has_1927 }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_lines)} potentially relevant lines') # Show the most promising lines for i, line_info in enumerate(relevant_lines[:10]): print(f' Line {line_info["line_number"]}: {line_info["content"][:100]}...') # Try to extract names from this line content = line_info['content'] # Look for names (two capitalized words) name_matches = re.findall(r'\b[A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+\b', content) if name_matches: print(f' Potential names: {name_matches}') # Create medalist entries for name in name_matches: medalist_entry = { 'source_file': target_file, 'line_number': line_info['line_number'], 'extracted_name': name, 'full_line': content, 'has_medal_info': line_info['has_medal_info'], 'has_country_info': line_info['has_country_info'], 'has_1927': line_info['has_1927'] } # Try to determine country content_lower = content.lower() if any(c in content_lower for c in ['sweden', 'swedish', 'swe']): medalist_entry['country'] = 'Sweden' elif any(c in content_lower for c in ['italy', 'italian', 'ita']): medalist_entry['country'] = 'Italy' else: medalist_entry['country'] = 'Unknown' all_medalists.append(medalist_entry) if line_info['has_medal_info'] and medalist_entry['country'] in ['Sweden', 'Italy']: print(f' *** POTENTIAL GOLD MEDALIST: {name} ({medalist_entry["country"]}) ***') # Also look for tables specifically tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f'\nFound {len(tables)} tables in {target_file}') for table_idx, table in enumerate(tables): # Simple table analysis without scope issues table_text_content = table.get_text() # Check if table contains relevant information table_lower = table_text_content.lower() has_medals = any(word in table_lower for word in ['gold', 'medal', 'winner', 'first']) has_countries = any(word in table_lower for word in ['sweden', 'italy', 'swe', 'ita']) if has_medals or has_countries: print(f' Table {table_idx + 1}: Contains medals={has_medals}, countries={has_countries}') # Get all table rows rows = table.find_all('tr') for row_idx, row in enumerate(rows[:5]): # Show first 5 rows cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) cell_texts = [cell.get_text().strip() for cell in cells] if len(cell_texts) > 1: print(f' Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}') else: print(f'File not found: {target_file}') print(f'\n=== EXTRACTION SUMMARY ===') print(f'Total potential medalists found: {len(all_medalists)}') # Filter for Sweden and Italy sweden_italy_medalists = [m for m in all_medalists if m.get('country') in ['Sweden', 'Italy']] print(f'Medalists from Sweden/Italy: {len(sweden_italy_medalists)}') if sweden_italy_medalists: print('\nSweden/Italy medalists found:') for i, medalist in enumerate(sweden_italy_medalists, 1): print(f'\n{i}. {medalist["extracted_name"]} ({medalist["country"]})') print(f' Source: {medalist["source_file"]}') print(f' Context: {medalist["full_line"][:150]}...') print(f' Has medal info: {medalist["has_medal_info"]}') print(f' Has 1927 reference: {medalist["has_1927"]}') else: print('\nNo clear Sweden/Italy medalists identified.') print('Showing all potential medalists for analysis:') for i, medalist in enumerate(all_medalists[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. {medalist["extracted_name"]} ({medalist.get("country", "Unknown")})') print(f' Context: {medalist["full_line"][:100]}...') # Save results results = { 'championship': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships', 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo', 'extraction_method': 'Simplified text parsing', 'total_potential_medalists': len(all_medalists), 'sweden_italy_medalists': len(sweden_italy_medalists), 'all_medalists': all_medalists, 'sweden_italy_only': sweden_italy_medalists } with open('workspace/fis_1927_simplified_extraction.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nResults saved to: workspace/fis_1927_simplified_extraction.json') print('Next step: Analyze results and research birth countries of identified medalists')
Execution Output

Cortina d'Ampezzo will host the Winter Olympics for a second time when it co-hosts the 2026 Winter Olympics with Milan. The town is home to SG Cortina, a top league professional ice hockey team, and Cortina d'Ampezzo is also the start and end point of the annual Dolomites Gold Cup Race.", "The town is home to SG Cortina, a professional ice hockey team in Serie A1, Italy's top division. Cortina d'Ampezzo is also the start and end point of the annual Dolomites Gold Cup Race, a historical re-evocation event for production cars on public roads.[85] The town hosted the Red Bull Road Rage in 2009.[86]", "Among the distinguished sportsmen from Cortina d'Ampezzo itself are the skiers Enrico Colli, his younger brother Vincenzo, and Giuseppe Ghedina who competed in the 1924 Winter Olympics, Severino Menardi who participated in the 1932 and 1936 Winter Olympics,[96] and Stefania Constantini, gold-medalist curler in the 2022 Winter Olympics. Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print('=== 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: GOLD MEDALIST BIRTH COUNTRIES ===') print('Target: Extract gold medalists and their birth countries from Cortina d\'Ampezzo 1927') print('Focus: Complete list of individual winners from Sweden and Italy with birthplaces\n') # First, examine the most promising existing JSON file workspace_path = 'workspace' results_file = 'fis_cortina_championship_final_results.json' print('=== EXAMINING EXISTING CHAMPIONSHIP RESULTS DATA ===') if os.path.exists(os.path.join(workspace_path, results_file)): print(f'Loading: {results_file}') with open(os.path.join(workspace_path, results_file), 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: championship_data = json.load(f) print('File structure:') for key, value in championship_data.items(): if isinstance(value, dict): print(f' {key}: Dict with keys {list(value.keys())}') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' {key}: List with {len(value)} items') if len(value) > 0: print(f' Sample item: {value[0]}') else: print(f' {key}: {value}') # Check if this contains gold medalist information if 'gold_medalists' in championship_data: gold_medalists = championship_data['gold_medalists'] print(f'\nFound gold_medalists data: {gold_medalists}') if 'medal_results_found' in championship_data: medal_results = championship_data['medal_results_found'] print(f'\nMedal results found: {len(medal_results)} entries') for i, result in enumerate(medal_results): print(f' Result {i+1}: {result}') if 'countries_with_gold_medals' in championship_data: countries = championship_data['countries_with_gold_medals'] print(f'\nCountries with gold medals: {countries}') else: print(f'File not found: {results_file}') print('\n=== PARSING HTML FILES WITH ROBUST APPROACH ===') # Now parse HTML files with a completely different, robust approach target_files = [ 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html' ] all_potential_medalists = [] for target_file in target_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_path, target_file) if os.path.exists(file_path): print(f'\nParsing: {target_file}') with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'Unknown title' print(f'Page title: {title_text}') # Extract all text and split into manageable chunks full_text = soup.get_text() # Look for sections that might contain results # Find headings that suggest results or medalists result_headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4'], string=re.compile(r'Results?|Medal|Winner|Champion|Event', re.IGNORECASE)) print(f'Found {len(result_headings)} result-related headings') for heading in result_headings: print(f' Heading: "{heading.get_text().strip()}"') # Simple table extraction without complex logic tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f'Found {len(tables)} tables') for table_idx, table in enumerate(tables): print(f'\n === TABLE {table_idx + 1} ANALYSIS ===') rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f' Rows: {len(rows)}') # Extract all table content as simple text table_content = table.get_text() # Check for relevant keywords content_lower = table_content.lower() has_gold = 'gold' in content_lower has_medal = 'medal' in content_lower has_winner = 'winner' in content_lower or 'first' in content_lower has_sweden = 'sweden' in content_lower or 'swe' in content_lower has_italy = 'italy' in content_lower or 'ita' in content_lower has_1927 = '1927' in content_lower print(f' Contains: gold={has_gold}, medal={has_medal}, winner={has_winner}') print(f' Countries: sweden={has_sweden}, italy={has_italy}, 1927={has_1927}') if has_gold or has_medal or has_winner or has_sweden or has_italy: print(f' *** RELEVANT TABLE - EXTRACTING DATA ***') # Show first few rows for context for row_idx in range(min(5, len(rows))): row = rows[row_idx] cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) if cells: cell_texts = [] for cell in cells: cell_text = cell.get_text().strip() cell_texts.append(cell_text) print(f' Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}') # Look for names in this row row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts) names_in_row = re.findall(r'\b[A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+\b', row_text) if names_in_row: print(f' Names found: {names_in_row}') # Check if this row mentions countries row_lower = row_text.lower() row_countries = [] if 'sweden' in row_lower or 'swe' in row_lower: row_countries.append('Sweden') if 'italy' in row_lower or 'ita' in row_lower: row_countries.append('Italy') # Store potential medalists for name in names_in_row: medalist = { 'name': name, 'source_file': target_file, 'table_index': table_idx + 1, 'row_index': row_idx, 'countries_in_row': row_countries, 'full_row_text': row_text, 'has_medal_indicators': has_gold or has_medal or has_winner } all_potential_medalists.append(medalist) if row_countries and (has_gold or has_medal or has_winner): print(f' *** POTENTIAL GOLD MEDALIST: {name} - Countries: {row_countries} ***') # Also search for specific text patterns mentioning gold medals print(f'\n === TEXT PATTERN SEARCH ===') # Look for patterns like "Gold medal: Name" or "Winner: Name (Country)" text_patterns = [ r'Gold.*?([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)', r'Winner.*?([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)', r'First.*?([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)', r'([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(Sweden\)', r'([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(Italy\)' ] for pattern in text_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, full_text) if matches: print(f' Pattern "{pattern}" found {len(matches)} matches: {matches[:3]}') for match in matches: # Determine context around the match match_pos = full_text.find(match) context_start = max(0, match_pos - 100) context_end = min(len(full_text), match_pos + 100) context = full_text[context_start:context_end].strip() # Check if context mentions Sweden or Italy context_lower = context.lower() countries_in_context = [] if 'sweden' in context_lower: countries_in_context.append('Sweden') if 'italy' in context_lower: countries_in_context.append('Italy') if countries_in_context: medalist = { 'name': match, 'source_file': target_file, 'extraction_method': 'text_pattern', 'pattern_used': pattern, 'countries_in_context': countries_in_context, 'context': context } all_potential_medalists.append(medalist) print(f' *** TEXT PATTERN MEDALIST: {match} - Countries: {countries_in_context} ***') else: print(f'File not found: {target_file}') print(f'\n=== FINAL EXTRACTION RESULTS ===') print(f'Total potential medalists found: {len(all_potential_medalists)}') # Filter for high-confidence results high_confidence_medalists = [] for medalist in all_potential_medalists: # High confidence if: # 1. Has medal indicators AND countries mentioned # 2. OR extracted via text pattern with countries has_medal_info = medalist.get('has_medal_indicators', False) has_countries = bool(medalist.get('countries_in_row', []) or medalist.get('countries_in_context', [])) is_text_pattern = medalist.get('extraction_method') == 'text_pattern' if (has_medal_info and has_countries) or (is_text_pattern and has_countries): high_confidence_medalists.append(medalist) print(f'High-confidence medalists: {len(high_confidence_medalists)}') if high_confidence_medalists: print('\n=== HIGH-CONFIDENCE GOLD MEDALISTS ===') for i, medalist in enumerate(high_confidence_medalists, 1): print(f'\n{i}. {medalist["name"]}') countries = medalist.get('countries_in_row', []) or medalist.get('countries_in_context', []) print(f' Countries: {countries}') print(f' Source: {medalist["source_file"]}') if 'full_row_text' in medalist: print(f' Context: {medalist["full_row_text"][:100]}...') elif 'context' in medalist: print(f' Context: {medalist["context"][:100]}...') else: print('\nNo high-confidence medalists found.') print('Showing all potential medalists:') for i, medalist in enumerate(all_potential_medalists[:10], 1): print(f'\n{i}. {medalist["name"]}') countries = medalist.get('countries_in_row', []) or medalist.get('countries_in_context', []) print(f' Countries: {countries}') print(f' Source: {medalist["source_file"]}') # Save comprehensive results final_results = { 'championship': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships', 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo, Italy', 'extraction_timestamp': '2024-01-01', 'total_potential_medalists': len(all_potential_medalists), 'high_confidence_medalists': len(high_confidence_medalists), 'sweden_italy_focus': True, 'all_medalists': all_potential_medalists, 'high_confidence_only': high_confidence_medalists } with open('workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_final.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nFinal results saved to: workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_final.json') print('Next phase: Research birth countries of identified gold medalists')
Execution Output

races\n"} gold_medalists: List with 0 items countries_with_gold_medals: List with 0 items all_countries_mentioned: List with 2 items Sample item: Italy Found gold_medalists data: [] Medal results Lahti\n1962 Zakopane\n1966 Oslo\n1970 Vysok√© Tatry\n1974 Falun\n1978 Lahti\n1980 Falun\n1982 Oslo\n1984 Rovaniemi/Engelberg\n1985 Seefeld\n1987 Oberstdorf\n1989 Lahti\n1991 Val di Fiemme\n1993 di Fiemme\n2015 Falun\n2017 Lahti\n2019 Seefeld\n2021 Oberstdorf\n2023 Planica\n2025 Trondheim\n2027 Falun\n2029 Lahti\n"} Countries with gold medals: [] === PARSING HTML FILES WITH ROBUST APPROACH found: ['Rank Nation', 'Gold Silver', 'Bronze Total'] Row 1: ['1', 'Sweden\xa0(SWE)', '3', '1', '1', '5'] Row 2: ['2', 'Czechoslovakia\xa0(TCH)', '1', '3', '2', '6'] Row 3: ['3', 'Germany\xa0(GER)', *** RELEVANT TABLE - EXTRACTING DATA *** Row 0: ['vteFIS Nordic World Ski Championships'] Names found: ['Nordic World', 'Ski Championships'] Row 1: ['Championships', "1925 Jansk√© L√°znƒõ\n1926 2025-08-12 03:42:07
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution successful - Code ran without errors and successfully extracted gold medalist data from the 1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships. The robust parsing approach found 44 potential medalists with 10 high-confidence results. Key findings: (1) Identified 3 Swedish gold medalists: John Lindgren (2 gold medals in cross-country events), Tore Edman (1 gold medal in ski jumping), plus additional Swedish medalists John Wikstr√∂m and Bertil Carlsson. (2) Medal table shows Sweden won 3 gold medals total, with Czechoslovakia winning 1 gold. (3) No Italian gold medalists were found in the 1927 championship results. The code correctly parsed the Wikipedia tables and extracted structured data showing event results with athlete names and country codes (SWE). **PLAN** alignment: 85% complete - successfully identified gold medalists from Sweden with their names and events, though birth countries still need to be researched. The output contains comprehensive medalist data and has been saved to workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_final.json. Next step: Research the specific birth countries of the identified Swedish gold medalists (John Lindgren, Tore Edman) to complete the PLAN requirements.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print('=== 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: GOLD MEDALIST BIRTH COUNTRIES ===') print('Target: Extract gold medalists and their birth countries from Cortina d\'Ampezzo 1927') print('Focus: Complete list of individual winners from Sweden and Italy with birthplaces\n') # First, examine the most promising existing JSON file workspace_path = 'workspace' results_file = 'fis_cortina_championship_final_results.json' print('=== EXAMINING EXISTING CHAMPIONSHIP RESULTS DATA ===') if os.path.exists(os.path.join(workspace_path, results_file)): print(f'Loading: {results_file}') with open(os.path.join(workspace_path, results_file), 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: championship_data = json.load(f) print('File structure:') for key, value in championship_data.items(): if isinstance(value, dict): print(f' {key}: Dict with keys {list(value.keys())}') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' {key}: List with {len(value)} items') if len(value) > 0: print(f' Sample item: {value[0]}') else: print(f' {key}: {value}') # Check if this contains gold medalist information if 'gold_medalists' in championship_data: gold_medalists = championship_data['gold_medalists'] print(f'\nFound gold_medalists data: {gold_medalists}') if 'medal_results_found' in championship_data: medal_results = championship_data['medal_results_found'] print(f'\nMedal results found: {len(medal_results)} entries') for i, result in enumerate(medal_results): print(f' Result {i+1}: {result}') if 'countries_with_gold_medals' in championship_data: countries = championship_data['countries_with_gold_medals'] print(f'\nCountries with gold medals: {countries}') else: print(f'File not found: {results_file}') print('\n=== PARSING HTML FILES WITH ROBUST APPROACH ===') # Now parse HTML files with a completely different, robust approach target_files = [ 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships_1927.html', 'en_wikipedia_org_wiki_1927_FIS_Nordic_World_Ski_Championships.html' ] all_potential_medalists = [] for target_file in target_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_path, target_file) if os.path.exists(file_path): print(f'\nParsing: {target_file}') with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Get page title title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'Unknown title' print(f'Page title: {title_text}') # Extract all text and split into manageable chunks full_text = soup.get_text() # Look for sections that might contain results # Find headings that suggest results or medalists result_headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4'], string=re.compile(r'Results?|Medal|Winner|Champion|Event', re.IGNORECASE)) print(f'Found {len(result_headings)} result-related headings') for heading in result_headings: print(f' Heading: "{heading.get_text().strip()}"') # Simple table extraction without complex logic tables = soup.find_all('table') print(f'Found {len(tables)} tables') for table_idx, table in enumerate(tables): print(f'\n === TABLE {table_idx + 1} ANALYSIS ===') rows = table.find_all('tr') print(f' Rows: {len(rows)}') # Extract all table content as simple text table_content = table.get_text() # Check for relevant keywords content_lower = table_content.lower() has_gold = 'gold' in content_lower has_medal = 'medal' in content_lower has_winner = 'winner' in content_lower or 'first' in content_lower has_sweden = 'sweden' in content_lower or 'swe' in content_lower has_italy = 'italy' in content_lower or 'ita' in content_lower has_1927 = '1927' in content_lower print(f' Contains: gold={has_gold}, medal={has_medal}, winner={has_winner}') print(f' Countries: sweden={has_sweden}, italy={has_italy}, 1927={has_1927}') if has_gold or has_medal or has_winner or has_sweden or has_italy: print(f' *** RELEVANT TABLE - EXTRACTING DATA ***') # Show first few rows for context for row_idx in range(min(5, len(rows))): row = rows[row_idx] cells = row.find_all(['td', 'th']) if cells: cell_texts = [] for cell in cells: cell_text = cell.get_text().strip() cell_texts.append(cell_text) print(f' Row {row_idx}: {cell_texts}') # Look for names in this row row_text = ' '.join(cell_texts) names_in_row = re.findall(r'\b[A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+\b', row_text) if names_in_row: print(f' Names found: {names_in_row}') # Check if this row mentions countries row_lower = row_text.lower() row_countries = [] if 'sweden' in row_lower or 'swe' in row_lower: row_countries.append('Sweden') if 'italy' in row_lower or 'ita' in row_lower: row_countries.append('Italy') # Store potential medalists for name in names_in_row: medalist = { 'name': name, 'source_file': target_file, 'table_index': table_idx + 1, 'row_index': row_idx, 'countries_in_row': row_countries, 'full_row_text': row_text, 'has_medal_indicators': has_gold or has_medal or has_winner } all_potential_medalists.append(medalist) if row_countries and (has_gold or has_medal or has_winner): print(f' *** POTENTIAL GOLD MEDALIST: {name} - Countries: {row_countries} ***') # Also search for specific text patterns mentioning gold medals print(f'\n === TEXT PATTERN SEARCH ===') # Look for patterns like "Gold medal: Name" or "Winner: Name (Country)" text_patterns = [ r'Gold.*?([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)', r'Winner.*?([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)', r'First.*?([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)', r'([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(Sweden\)', r'([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+).*?\(Italy\)' ] for pattern in text_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, full_text) if matches: print(f' Pattern "{pattern}" found {len(matches)} matches: {matches[:3]}') for match in matches: # Determine context around the match match_pos = full_text.find(match) context_start = max(0, match_pos - 100) context_end = min(len(full_text), match_pos + 100) context = full_text[context_start:context_end].strip() # Check if context mentions Sweden or Italy context_lower = context.lower() countries_in_context = [] if 'sweden' in context_lower: countries_in_context.append('Sweden') if 'italy' in context_lower: countries_in_context.append('Italy') if countries_in_context: medalist = { 'name': match, 'source_file': target_file, 'extraction_method': 'text_pattern', 'pattern_used': pattern, 'countries_in_context': countries_in_context, 'context': context } all_potential_medalists.append(medalist) print(f' *** TEXT PATTERN MEDALIST: {match} - Countries: {countries_in_context} ***') else: print(f'File not found: {target_file}') print(f'\n=== FINAL EXTRACTION RESULTS ===') print(f'Total potential medalists found: {len(all_potential_medalists)}') # Filter for high-confidence results high_confidence_medalists = [] for medalist in all_potential_medalists: # High confidence if: # 1. Has medal indicators AND countries mentioned # 2. OR extracted via text pattern with countries has_medal_info = medalist.get('has_medal_indicators', False) has_countries = bool(medalist.get('countries_in_row', []) or medalist.get('countries_in_context', [])) is_text_pattern = medalist.get('extraction_method') == 'text_pattern' if (has_medal_info and has_countries) or (is_text_pattern and has_countries): high_confidence_medalists.append(medalist) print(f'High-confidence medalists: {len(high_confidence_medalists)}') if high_confidence_medalists: print('\n=== HIGH-CONFIDENCE GOLD MEDALISTS ===') for i, medalist in enumerate(high_confidence_medalists, 1): print(f'\n{i}. {medalist["name"]}') countries = medalist.get('countries_in_row', []) or medalist.get('countries_in_context', []) print(f' Countries: {countries}') print(f' Source: {medalist["source_file"]}') if 'full_row_text' in medalist: print(f' Context: {medalist["full_row_text"][:100]}...') elif 'context' in medalist: print(f' Context: {medalist["context"][:100]}...') else: print('\nNo high-confidence medalists found.') print('Showing all potential medalists:') for i, medalist in enumerate(all_potential_medalists[:10], 1): print(f'\n{i}. {medalist["name"]}') countries = medalist.get('countries_in_row', []) or medalist.get('countries_in_context', []) print(f' Countries: {countries}') print(f' Source: {medalist["source_file"]}') # Save comprehensive results final_results = { 'championship': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships', 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo, Italy', 'extraction_timestamp': '2024-01-01', 'total_potential_medalists': len(all_potential_medalists), 'high_confidence_medalists': len(high_confidence_medalists), 'sweden_italy_focus': True, 'all_medalists': all_potential_medalists, 'high_confidence_only': high_confidence_medalists } with open('workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_final.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nFinal results saved to: workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_final.json') print('Next phase: Research birth countries of identified gold medalists')
Execution Output
Code Output: === 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: GOLD MEDALIST BIRTH COUNTRIES === Target: Extract gold medalists and their birth countries from Cortina d'Ampezzo 1927 Focus: Complete list of individual winners from Sweden and Italy with birthplaces === EXAMINING EXISTING CHAMPIONSHIP RESULTS DATA === Loading: fis_cortina_championship_final_results.json File structure: target_championship: developer
2025-08-12 03:43:54
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 9)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import time print('=== 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS: GOLD MEDALISTS BIRTH COUNTRIES ===') print('Target: Research birth countries of identified Swedish gold medalists') print('Focus: John Lindgren and Tore Edman biographical information\n') # First, let's examine the extracted results file to understand the exact medalists workspace_path = 'workspace' results_file = 'fis_1927_gold_medalists_final.json' print('=== EXAMINING EXTRACTED GOLD MEDALIST DATA ===') if os.path.exists(os.path.join(workspace_path, results_file)): print(f'Loading: {results_file}') with open(os.path.join(workspace_path, results_file), 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: medalist_data = json.load(f) print('File structure inspection:') for key, value in medalist_data.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f' {key}: List with {len(value)} items') elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f' {key}: Dict with keys {list(value.keys())}') else: print(f' {key}: {value}') # Extract the actual gold medalists (not just potential ones) print('\n=== IDENTIFYING CONFIRMED GOLD MEDALISTS ===') high_confidence = medalist_data.get('high_confidence_only', []) print(f'High confidence medalists: {len(high_confidence)}') # Filter for actual gold medalists (not silver/bronze) confirmed_gold_medalists = [] for medalist in high_confidence: context = medalist.get('full_row_text', '') name = medalist.get('name', '') # Check if this is actually a gold medalist if 'Gold' in context and 'Sweden' in str(medalist.get('countries_in_row', [])): # Extract the actual athlete name from the context # Context format: "Gold John Lindgren (SWE) time" import re name_match = re.search(r'Gold\s+([A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)', context) if name_match: actual_name = name_match.group(1) confirmed_gold_medalists.append({ 'name': actual_name, 'country': 'Sweden', 'context': context, 'medal_type': 'Gold' }) print(f' Confirmed gold medalist: {actual_name} (Sweden)') print(f'\nConfirmed Swedish gold medalists: {len(confirmed_gold_medalists)}') for medalist in confirmed_gold_medalists: print(f' - {medalist["name"]}') else: print(f'Results file not found: {results_file}') # Use the information from the tester feedback confirmed_gold_medalists = [ {'name': 'John Lindgren', 'country': 'Sweden', 'medal_type': 'Gold'}, {'name': 'Tore Edman', 'country': 'Sweden', 'medal_type': 'Gold'} ] print('Using medalists from tester feedback:') for medalist in confirmed_gold_medalists: print(f' - {medalist["name"]}') print('\n=== RESEARCHING BIRTH COUNTRIES OF GOLD MEDALISTS ===') # Research each gold medalist's birth country headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } medalists_with_birth_info = [] for medalist in confirmed_gold_medalists: name = medalist['name'] print(f'\n--- Researching {name} ---') # Search for biographical information search_urls = [ f'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/{name.replace(" ", "_")}_skiing', f'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/{name.replace(" ", "_")}_(skier)', f'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/{name.replace(" ", "_")}', ] birth_country_found = None birth_info = None for url in search_urls: print(f' Trying: {url}') try: response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=15) print(f' Response status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: print(f' ‚úì Successfully accessed {url}') # Save the content for analysis filename = url.replace('https://', '').replace('http://', '').replace('/', '_').replace('.', '_') + '.html' filepath = f'workspace/{filename}' with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) # Parse for birth information soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') title = soup.find('title') title_text = title.get_text().strip() if title else 'No title' print(f' Page title: {title_text}') # Look for birth information text_content = soup.get_text().lower() # Search for birth-related keywords birth_indicators = ['born', 'birth', 'native', 'from'] country_indicators = ['sweden', 'swedish', 'norway', 'norwegian', 'finland', 'finnish'] # Look for birth information patterns full_text = soup.get_text() # Pattern 1: "born in [location]" born_pattern = re.search(r'born\s+(?:in\s+)?([A-Z][a-zA-Z\s,]+)', full_text, re.IGNORECASE) if born_pattern: birth_location = born_pattern.group(1).strip() print(f' Birth pattern found: "born {birth_location}"') # Check if this mentions a country birth_lower = birth_location.lower() if 'sweden' in birth_lower: birth_country_found = 'Sweden' elif 'norway' in birth_lower: birth_country_found = 'Norway' elif 'finland' in birth_lower: birth_country_found = 'Finland' birth_info = birth_location # Pattern 2: Look in infobox or biographical sections infoboxes = soup.find_all('table', class_=re.compile(r'infobox', re.I)) for infobox in infoboxes: infobox_text = infobox.get_text() if 'born' in infobox_text.lower(): print(f' Infobox birth info: {infobox_text[:200]}...') # Extract birth information from infobox infobox_lower = infobox_text.lower() if 'sweden' in infobox_lower and not birth_country_found: birth_country_found = 'Sweden' birth_info = 'From infobox: Sweden' elif 'norway' in infobox_lower and not birth_country_found: birth_country_found = 'Norway' birth_info = 'From infobox: Norway' if birth_country_found: print(f' *** BIRTH COUNTRY FOUND: {birth_country_found} ***') break else: print(f' No clear birth country information found') else: print(f' ‚úó Failed to access - Status: {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f' ‚úó Error accessing {url}: {str(e)}') time.sleep(2) # Be respectful to servers # Store the results medalist_info = { 'name': name, 'represented_country': medalist['country'], 'birth_country': birth_country_found if birth_country_found else 'Unknown', 'birth_info': birth_info, 'medal_type': medalist['medal_type'], 'championship': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships', 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo, Italy' } medalists_with_birth_info.append(medalist_info) print(f' Final result for {name}:') print(f' Represented: {medalist["country"]}') print(f' Born in: {birth_country_found if birth_country_found else "Unknown"}') print('\n=== FINAL RESULTS: 1927 FIS NORDIC WORLD SKI CHAMPIONSHIPS GOLD MEDALISTS ===') print('Championship: 1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships') print('Location: Cortina d\'Ampezzo, Italy') print('Focus: Birth countries of gold medalists from Sweden and Italy\n') swedish_gold_medalists = [m for m in medalists_with_birth_info if m['represented_country'] == 'Sweden'] italian_gold_medalists = [m for m in medalists_with_birth_info if m['represented_country'] == 'Italy'] print(f'Swedish gold medalists: {len(swedish_gold_medalists)}') for medalist in swedish_gold_medalists: print(f' - {medalist["name"]}') print(f' Birth country: {medalist["birth_country"]}') if medalist['birth_info']: print(f' Birth info: {medalist["birth_info"]}') print() print(f'Italian gold medalists: {len(italian_gold_medalists)}') if italian_gold_medalists: for medalist in italian_gold_medalists: print(f' - {medalist["name"]}') print(f' Birth country: {medalist["birth_country"]}') else: print(' No Italian gold medalists found in 1927 championship') # Summary of birth countries print('\n=== BIRTH COUNTRY SUMMARY ===') birth_countries = {} for medalist in medalists_with_birth_info: birth_country = medalist['birth_country'] if birth_country not in birth_countries: birth_countries[birth_country] = [] birth_countries[birth_country].append(medalist['name']) for country, names in birth_countries.items(): print(f'{country}: {len(names)} gold medalist(s)') for name in names: print(f' - {name}') # Save comprehensive results final_results = { 'championship': '1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships', 'location': 'Cortina d\'Ampezzo, Italy', 'research_focus': 'Birth countries of gold medalists from Sweden and Italy', 'total_gold_medalists_researched': len(medalists_with_birth_info), 'swedish_representatives': len(swedish_gold_medalists), 'italian_representatives': len(italian_gold_medalists), 'birth_country_summary': birth_countries, 'detailed_medalists': medalists_with_birth_info } with open('workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_birth_countries.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nComplete results saved to: workspace/fis_1927_gold_medalists_birth_countries.json') print('Research complete: Birth countries of 1927 FIS Nordic World Ski Championships gold medalists identified')
Execution Output
